dataType.name: MACAddress
dataType.description: All MAC addresses are represented as strings of 12 hexadecimal digits (digits 0-9, letters A-F or a-f) displayed as six pairs of digits separated by colons. Unspecified or inapplicable MAC addresses MUST be represented as empty strings unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition.

dataType.name: IPAddress
dataType.description:
IP address, i.e. IPv4 address (or IPv4 subnet mask) or IPv6 address.
All IPv4 addresses and subnet masks MUST be represented as strings in IPv4 dotted-decimal notation. Here are some examples of valid IPv4 address textual representations:
* 216.52.29.100
* 192.168.1.254
All IPv6 addresses MUST be represented using any of the 3 standard textual representations defined in {{bibref|RFC4291}} Sections 2.2.1, 2.2.2 and 2.2.3. Both lower-case and upper-case letters can be used, but use of lower-case letters is RECOMMENDED. Here are some examples of valid IPv6 address textual representations:
* 1080:0:0:800:ba98:3210:11aa:12dd
* 1080::800:ba98:3210:11aa:12dd
* 0:0:0:0:0:0:13.1.68.3
IPv6 addresses MUST NOT include zone identifiers. Zone identifiers are discussed in {{bibref|RFC4007|Section 6}}.
Unspecified or inapplicable addresses (or IPv4 subnet masks) MUST be represented as empty strings unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition.

object.name: Device.
object.description: The top-level object for a Device.

parameter.name: DeviceSummary
parameter.description: See {{bibref|TR-106|section 3.7}}.

parameter.name: UserNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in the User table.

parameter.name: SmartCardReaderNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in the SmartCardReader table.

object.name: Device.Services.
object.description: This object contains general services information.

object.name: Device.DeviceInfo.
object.description: This object contains general device information.

parameter.name: Manufacturer
parameter.description: The manufacturer of the CPE (human readable string).

parameter.name: ManufacturerOUI
parameter.description: Organizationally unique identifier of the device manufacturer. Represented as a six hexadecimal-digit value using all upper-case letters and including any leading zeros. The value MUST be a valid OUI as defined in {{bibref|OUI}}.{{np}}This value MUST remain fixed over the lifetime of the device, including across firmware updates.

parameter.name: ModelName
parameter.description: Model name of the CPE (human readable string).

parameter.name: Description
parameter.description: A full description of the CPE device (human readable string).

parameter.name: ProductClass
parameter.description: Identifier of the class of product for which the serial number applies. That is, for a given manufacturer, this parameter is used to identify the product or class of product over which the {{param|SerialNumber}} parameter is unique.{{np}}This value MUST remain fixed over the lifetime of the device, including across firmware updates.

parameter.name: SerialNumber
parameter.description: Serial number of the CPE.{{np}}This value MUST remain fixed over the lifetime of the device, including across firmware updates.

parameter.name: HardwareVersion
parameter.description: A string identifying the particular CPE model and version.

parameter.name: SoftwareVersion
parameter.description: A string identifying the software version currently installed in the CPE. To allow version comparisons, this element SHOULD be in the form of dot-delimited integers, where each successive integer represents a more minor category of variation. For example, ''3.0.21'' where the components mean: ''Major.Minor.Build''.

parameter.name: EnabledOptions
parameter.description: Comma-separated list of the OptionName of each Option that is currently enabled in the CPE. The OptionName of each is identical to the OptionName element of the OptionStruct described in {{bibref|TR-069a2}}. Only those options are listed whose State indicates the option is enabled.

parameter.name: AdditionalHardwareVersion
parameter.description: A comma-separated list of any additional versions. Represents any additional hardware version information the vendor might wish to supply.

parameter.name: AdditionalSoftwareVersion
parameter.description: A comma-separated list of any additional versions. Represents any additional software version information the vendor might wish to supply.

parameter.name: ProvisioningCode
parameter.description: Identifier of the primary service provider and other provisioning information, which MAY be used by the ACS to determine service provider-specific customization and provisioning parameters.

parameter.name: DeviceStatus
parameter.description: Current operational status of the device.

parameter.name: UpTime
parameter.description: Time in seconds since the CPE was last restarted.

parameter.name: FirstUseDate
parameter.description: Date and time in UTC that the CPE first both successfully established an IP-layer network connection and acquired an absolute time reference using NTP or equivalent over that network connection. The CPE MAY reset this date after a factory reset.{{np}}If NTP or equivalent is not available, this parameter, if present, SHOULD be set to the Unknown Time value.

parameter.name: DeviceLog
parameter.description: Vendor-specific log(s).

object.name: Device.DeviceInfo.MemoryStatus.
object.description: Status of the device's volatile physical memory.

parameter.name: Total
parameter.description: The total physical RAM, in {{units}}, installed on the device.

parameter.name: Free
parameter.description: The free physical RAM, in {{units}}, currently available on the device.

object.name: Device.DeviceInfo.ProcessStatus.
object.description: Status of the processes on the device.

parameter.name: CPUUsage
parameter.description: The total amount of the CPU, in {{units}}, rounded up to the nearest whole {{units}}. In the case that multiple CPU are present, this value represents the average of all CPU.

parameter.name: ProcessNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in the Process table. Since a Process can come and go very quickly, the CPE SHOULD place a locally specified limit on the frequency at which it will notify the ACS of value changes, as described in {{bibref|TR-069a2|Section 3.2.1}}.

object.name: Device.DeviceInfo.ProcessStatus.Process.{i}.
object.description: List of all processes running on the device.

parameter.name: PID
parameter.description: The Process Identifier.

parameter.name: Command
parameter.description: The name of the command that has caused the process to exist.

parameter.name: Size
parameter.description: The size in {{units}} of the memory occupied by the process.

parameter.name: Priority
parameter.description: The priority of the process where 0 is highest.

parameter.name: CPUTime
parameter.description: The amount of time in {{units}} that the process has spent taking up CPU time since the process was started.

parameter.name: State
parameter.description: The current state that the process is in.

object.name: Device.DeviceInfo.TemperatureStatus.
object.description: Status of the temperature of the device.

parameter.name: TemperatureSensorNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in TemperatureSensor table.

object.name: Device.DeviceInfo.TemperatureStatus.TemperatureSensor.{i}.
object.description: This object represents information that the device has obtained via sampling an internal temperature sensor.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not the temperature sensor is enabled.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of this temperature sensor.

enumeration.description: The sensor is not currently sampling the temperature.
The sensor is currently sampling the temperature.
The sensor error currently prevents sampling the temperature.

parameter.name: Reset
parameter.description: When set to {{true}}, resets the temperature sensor.

parameter.name: ResetTime
parameter.description: The time at which this temperature sensor was reset. Reset can be caused by: * {{param|Status}} transition from {{enum|Disabled|Status}} to {{enum|Enabled|Status}} * {{param|Reset}} set to {{true}}. * An internal reset of the temperature sensor (including a reboot of the device). The Unknown Time value, as defined in {{bibref|TR-106a2}}, indicates that this temperature sensor has never been reset, which can only happen if it has never been enabled.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Name of this temperature sensor. This text MUST be sufficient to distinguish this temperature sensor from other temperature sensors.

parameter.name: Value
parameter.description: This temperature sensor's last good reading in {{units}}. A value of -274 (which is below absolute zero) indicates a good reading has not been obtained since last reset.

parameter.name: LastUpdate
parameter.description: The time at which this temperature sensor's last good reading was obtained. The Unknown Time value, as defined in {{bibref|TR-106a2}}, indicates a good reading has not been obtained since last reset.

parameter.name: MinValue
parameter.description: This temperature sensor's lowest value reading in {{units}} since last reset. A value of -274 (which is below absolute zero) indicates a good reading has not been obtained since last reset.

parameter.name: MinTime
parameter.description: The time at which this temperature sensor's lowest value was read. The Unknown Time value, as defined in {{bibref|TR-106a2}}, indicates a good reading has not been obtained since last reset.

parameter.name: MaxValue
parameter.description: This temperature sensor's highest value reading in {{units}} since last reset. A value of -274 (which is below absolute zero) indicates a good reading has not been obtained since last reset.

parameter.name: MaxTime
parameter.description: The time at which this temperature sensor's highest value was read. The Unknown Time value, as defined in {{bibref|TR-106a2}}, indicates a good reading has not been obtained since last reset.

parameter.name: LowAlarmValue
parameter.description: This temperature sensor's low alarm value in {{units}}. A value of -274 (which is below absolute zero) indicates a non configured value.

parameter.name: LowAlarmTime
parameter.description: Initial time at which this temperature sensor's {{param|LowAlarmValue}} was encountered. This value is only set the first time the alarm is seen and not changed until the next reset. The Unknown Time value, as defined in {{bibref|TR-106a2}}, indicates that an alarm has not been encountered since the last reset.

parameter.name: HighAlarmValue
parameter.description: This temperature sensor's high alarm value in {{units}}. A value of -274 (which is below absolute zero) indicates a non configured value.

parameter.name: HighAlarmTime
parameter.description: Initial time at which this temperature sensor's {{param|HighAlarmValue}} was encountered. This value is only set the first time the alarm is seen and not changed until the next reset. The Unknown Time value, as defined in {{bibref|TR-106a2}}, indicates that an alarm has not been encountered since the last reset.

object.name: Device.DeviceInfo.NetworkProperties.
object.description: This object defines the parameters that describe how the device handles network traffic.

parameter.name: MaxTCPWindowSize
parameter.description: The maximum number of {{units}} of outstanding data a sender can send on a particular connection prior to an acknowledgment {{bibref|RFC793}}. Any scaling factor SHOULD be included in this parameter {{bibref|RFC1323}}.

parameter.name: TCPImplementation
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the TCP congestion control mechanism(s) implemented. {{enum}} Tahoe, Reno, and New Reno are defined in {{bibref|RFC2582}}

enumeration.description: Represents the base TCP implementation in {{bibref|RFC793}} and elements of {{bibref|RFC2582}}
Represents the base TCP implementation in {{bibref|RFC793}} with the additional algorithms defined in {{bibref|RFC2581}}
Described as a modification to the Reno algorithms in {{bibref|RFC2582}}
An emerging TCP congestion control mechanism

object.name: Device.ManagementServer.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to the CPE's association with an ACS.

parameter.name: URL
parameter.description: URL, as defined in {{bibref|RFC3986}}, for the CPE to connect to the ACS using the CPE WAN Management Protocol. This parameter MUST be in the form of a valid HTTP or HTTPS URL. The ''host'' portion of this URL is used by the CPE for validating the ACS certificate when using SSL or TLS. Note that on a factory reset of the CPE, the value of this parameter might be reset to its factory value. If an ACS modifies the value of this parameter, it SHOULD be prepared to accommodate the situation that the original value is restored as the result of a factory reset.

parameter.name: Username
parameter.description: Username used to authenticate the CPE when making a connection to the ACS using the CPE WAN Management Protocol. This username is used only for HTTP-based authentication of the CPE.{{np}}Note that on a factory reset of the CPE, the value of this parameter might be reset to its factory value. If an ACS modifies the value of this parameter, it SHOULD be prepared to accommodate the situation that the original value is restored as the result of a factory reset.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: Password used to authenticate the CPE when making a connection to the ACS using the CPE WAN Management Protocol. This password is used only for HTTP-based authentication of the CPE. When read, this parameter returns {{empty}}, regardless of the actual value.{{np}}Note that on a factory reset of the CPE, the value of this parameter might be reset to its factory value. If an ACS modifies the value of this parameter, it SHOULD be prepared to accommodate the situation that the original value is restored as the result of a factory reset.

parameter.name: PeriodicInformEnable
parameter.description: Whether or not the CPE MUST periodically send CPE information to the ACS using the Inform method call.

parameter.name: PeriodicInformInterval
parameter.description: The duration in seconds of the interval for which the CPE MUST attempt to connect with the ACS and call the Inform method if {{param|PeriodicInformEnable}} is {{true}}.

parameter.name: PeriodicInformTime
parameter.description: An absolute time reference in UTC to determine when the CPE will initiate the periodic Inform method calls. Each Inform call MUST occur at this reference time plus or minus an integer multiple of the {{param|PeriodicInformInterval}}. {{param}} is used only to set the ''phase'' of the periodic Informs. The actual value of {{param}} can be arbitrarily far into the past or future. For example, if {{param|PeriodicInformInterval}} is 86400 (a day) and if {{param}} is set to UTC midnight on some day (in the past, present, or future) then periodic Informs will occur every day at UTC midnight. These MUST begin on the very next midnight, even if {{param}} refers to a day in the future. The Unknown Time value defined in {{bibref|TR-106a2|section 3.2}} indicates that no particular time reference is specified. That is, the CPE MAY locally choose the time reference, and needs only to adhere to the specified {{param|PeriodicInformInterval}}. If absolute time is not available to the CPE, its periodic Inform behavior MUST be the same as if the {{param}} parameter was set to the Unknown Time value.

parameter.name: ParameterKey
parameter.description: {{param}} provides the ACS a reliable and extensible means to track changes made by the ACS. The value of {{param}} MUST be equal to the value of the ParameterKey argument from the most recent successful SetParameterValues, AddObject, or DeleteObject method call from the ACS. The CPE MUST set {{param}} to the value specified in the corresponding method arguments if and only if the method completes successfully and no fault response is generated. If a method call does not complete successfully (implying that the changes requested in the method did not take effect), the value of {{param}} MUST NOT be modified. The CPE MUST only modify the value of {{param}} as a result of SetParameterValues, AddObject, DeleteObject, or due to a factory reset. On factory reset, the value of {{param}} MUST be set to {{empty}}.

parameter.name: ConnectionRequestURL
parameter.description: HTTP URL, as defined in {{bibref|RFC3986}}, for an ACS to make a Connection Request notification to the CPE. In the form: : http://host:port/path The ''host'' portion of the URL MAY be the IP address for the management interface of the CPE in lieu of a host name.

parameter.name: ConnectionRequestUsername
parameter.description: Username used to authenticate an ACS making a Connection Request to the CPE.

parameter.name: ConnectionRequestPassword
parameter.description: Password used to authenticate an ACS making a Connection Request to the CPE. When read, this parameter returns {{empty}}, regardless of the actual value.

parameter.name: UpgradesManaged
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not the ACS will manage upgrades for the CPE. If {{true}}, the CPE SHOULD NOT use other means other than the ACS to seek out available upgrades. If {{false}}, the CPE MAY use other means for this purpose. Note that an autonomous upgrade (reported via an "10 AUTONOMOUS TRANSFER COMPLETE" Inform Event code) SHOULD be regarded as a managed upgrade if it is performed according to ACS-specified policy.

parameter.name: KickURL
parameter.description: Present only for a CPE that supports the Kicked RPC method. LAN-accessible URL, as defined in {{bibref|RFC3986}}, from which the CPE can be ''kicked'' to initiate the Kicked RPC method call. MUST be an absolute URL including a host name or IP address as would be used on the LAN side of the CPE.

parameter.name: DownloadProgressURL
parameter.description: Present only for a CPE that provides a LAN-side web page to show progress during a file download. LAN-accessible URL, as defined in {{bibref|RFC3986}}, to which a web-server associated with the ACS MAY redirect a user's browser on initiation of a file download to observer the status of the download.

parameter.name: UDPConnectionRequestAddress
parameter.description: Address and port to which an ACS MAY send a UDP Connection Request to the CPE (see {{bibref|TR-069a2|Annex G}}). This parameter is represented in the form of an Authority element as defined in {{bibref|RFC3986}}. The value MUST be in one of the following two forms: : host:port : host * When {{param|STUNEnable}} is {{true}}, the ''host'' and ''port'' portions of this parameter MUST represent the public address and port corresponding to the NAT binding through which the ACS can send UDP Connection Request messages (once this information is learned by the CPE through the use of STUN). * When {{param|STUNEnable}} is {{false}}, the ''host'' and ''port'' portions of the URL MUST represent the local IP address and port on which the CPE is listening for UDP Connection Request messages. The second form of this parameter MAY be used only if the port value is equal to ''80''.

parameter.name: UDPConnectionRequestAddressNotificationLimit
parameter.description: The minimum time, in seconds, between Active Notifications resulting from changes to the {{param|UDPConnectionRequestAddress}} (if Active Notification is enabled).

parameter.name: STUNEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the use of STUN by the CPE. This applies only to the use of STUN in association with the ACS to allow UDP Connection Requests.

parameter.name: STUNServerAddress
parameter.description: Host name or IP address of the STUN server for the CPE to send Binding Requests if STUN is enabled via {{param|STUNEnable}}. If is {{empty}} and {{param|STUNEnable}} is {{true}}, the CPE MUST use the address of the ACS extracted from the host portion of the ACS URL.

parameter.name: STUNServerPort
parameter.description: Port number of the STUN server for the CPE to send Binding Requests if STUN is enabled via {{param|STUNEnable}}. By default, this SHOULD be the equal to the default STUN port, 3478.

parameter.name: STUNUsername
parameter.description: If is not {{empty}}, the value of the STUN USERNAME attribute to be used in Binding Requests (only if message integrity has been requested by the STUN server). If is {{empty}}, the CPE MUST NOT send STUN Binding Requests with message integrity.

parameter.name: STUNPassword
parameter.description: The value of the STUN Password to be used in computing the MESSAGE-INTEGRITY attribute to be used in Binding Requests (only if message integrity has been requested by the STUN server). When read, this parameter returns {{empty}}, regardless of the actual value.

parameter.name: STUNMaximumKeepAlivePeriod
parameter.description: If STUN Is enabled, the maximum period, in seconds, that STUN Binding Requests MUST be sent by the CPE for the purpose of maintaining the binding in the Gateway. This applies specifically to Binding Requests sent from the UDP Connection Request address and port. A value of -1 indicates that no maximum period is specified.

parameter.name: STUNMinimumKeepAlivePeriod
parameter.description: If STUN Is enabled, the minimum period, in seconds, that STUN Binding Requests can be sent by the CPE for the purpose of maintaining the binding in the Gateway. This limit applies only to Binding Requests sent from the UDP Connection Request address and port, and only those that do not contain the BINDING-CHANGE attribute. This limit does not apply to retransmissions following the procedures defined in {{bibref|RFC3489}}.

parameter.name: NATDetected
parameter.description: When STUN is enabled, this parameter indicates whether or not the CPE has detected address and/or port mapping in use. A {{true}} value indicates that the received MAPPED-ADDRESS in the most recent Binding Response differs from the CPE's source address and port. When {{param|STUNEnable}} is {{false}}, this value MUST be {{false}}.

object.name: Device.ManagementServer.AutonomousTransferCompletePolicy.
object.description: This object allows configuration of CPE policy for notification of AUTONOMOUS TRANSFER COMPLETE events, defined in {{bibref|TR-069a2}}. The CPE policy determines the conditions under which the CPE notifies the ACS of the completion of file transfers that were not specifically requested by the ACS.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enable/disable CPE notification of AUTONOMOUS TRANSFER COMPLETE events to the ACS.

parameter.name: TransferTypeFilter
parameter.description: Indicates the transfer types that MUST be included when the CPE notifies the ACS of AUTONOMOUS TRANSFER COMPLETE events. Transfer types not indicated by this filter MUST NOT be included when the CPE notifies the ACS. {{enum}} Note that this includes any backup or restore operations that were not specifically requested by the ACS. A backup is regarded as an Upload and a restore is regarded as a Download.

enumeration.description: Upload and Download

parameter.name: FileTypeFilter
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the file types that MUST be included when the CPE notifies the ACS of AUTONOMOUS TRANSFER COMPLETE events. File types omitted from this list MUST NOT be included when the CPE notifies the ACS. {{pattern}} Additionally, the following format is defined to allow the unique definition of vendor-specific file types: * ''"X <OUI> <Vendor-specific identifier>"'' <OUI> is replaced by a 6 hexadecimal-digit OUI (organizationally unique identifier) as defined in {{bibref|OUI}}, with all upper-case letters and any leading zeros included. The OUI used for a given vendor-specific file type MUST be one that is assigned to the organization that defined this file type (which is not necessarily the same as the vendor of the CPE or ACS). Note that {{empty}} indicates that all file types are excluded from this filter, effectively disabling CPE notification of AUTONOMOUS TRANSFER COMPLETE events to the ACS.

pattern.description: For Vendor-Specific File Types, could be for either Download or Upload

object.name: Device.GatewayInfo.
object.description: This object contains information associated with a connected Internet Gateway Device.

parameter.name: ManufacturerOUI
parameter.description: Organizationally unique identifier of the associated Internet Gateway Device. {{empty}} indicates that there is no associated Internet Gateway Device that has been detected.

parameter.name: ProductClass
parameter.description: Identifier of the product class of the associated Internet Gateway Device. {{empty}} indicates either that there is no associated Internet Gateway Device that has been detected, or the Internet Gateway Device does not support the use of the product-class parameter.

parameter.name: SerialNumber
parameter.description: Serial number of the associated Internet Gateway Device. {{empty}} indicates that there is no associated Internet Gateway Device that has been detected.

object.name: Device.Config.
object.description: This object contains general configuration parameters.

parameter.name: PersistentData
parameter.description: Arbitrary user data that MUST persist across CPE reboots.

parameter.name: ConfigFile
parameter.description: A dump of the currently running configuration on the CPE. This parameter enables the ability to backup and restore the last known good state of the CPE. It returns a vendor-specific document that defines the state of the CPE. The document MUST be capable of restoring the CPE's state when written back to the CPE using SetParameterValues.{{np}}An alternative to this parameter, e.g. when the configuration file is larger than the parameter size limit, is to use the Upload and Download RPCs with a FileType of ''1 Vendor Configuration File''.

object.name: Device.Time.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating an NTP or SNTP time client in the CPE.

parameter.name: NTPServer1
parameter.description: First NTP timeserver. Either a host name or IP address.

parameter.name: NTPServer2
parameter.description: Second NTP timeserver. Either a host name or IP address.

parameter.name: NTPServer3
parameter.description: Third NTP timeserver. Either a host name or IP address.

parameter.name: NTPServer4
parameter.description: Fourth NTP timeserver. Either a host name or IP address.

parameter.name: NTPServer5
parameter.description: Fifth NTP timeserver. Either a host name or IP address.

parameter.name: CurrentLocalTime
parameter.description: The current date and time in the CPE's local time zone.

parameter.name: LocalTimeZone
parameter.description: The local time zone definition, encoded according to IEEE 1003.1 (POSIX). The following is an example value: : EST+5 EDT,M4.1.0/2,M10.5.0/2

object.name: Device.UserInterface.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to the user interface of the CPE.

parameter.name: PasswordRequired
parameter.description: Present only if the CPE provides a password-protected LAN-side user interface. Indicates whether or not the local user interface MUST require a password to be chosen by the user. If {{false}}, the choice of whether or not a password is used is left to the user.

parameter.name: PasswordUserSelectable
parameter.description: Present only if the CPE provides a password-protected LAN-side user interface and supports LAN-side Auto-Configuration. Indicates whether or not a password to protect the local user interface of the CPE MAY be selected by the user directly, or MUST be equal to the password used by the LAN-side Auto-Configuration protocol.

parameter.name: UpgradeAvailable
parameter.description: Indicates that a CPE upgrade is available, allowing the CPE to display this information to the user.

parameter.name: WarrantyDate
parameter.description: Indicates the date and time in UTC that the warranty associated with the CPE is to expire.

parameter.name: ISPName
parameter.description: The name of the customer's ISP.

parameter.name: ISPHelpDesk
parameter.description: The help desk phone number of the ISP.

parameter.name: ISPHomePage
parameter.description: The URL of the ISP's home page.

parameter.name: ISPHelpPage
parameter.description: The URL of the ISP's on-line support page.

parameter.name: ISPLogo
parameter.description: Base64 encoded GIF or JPEG image. The binary image is constrained to 4095 bytes or less.

parameter.name: ISPLogoSize
parameter.description: Un-encoded binary image size in bytes. If ISPLogoSize input value is 0 then the ISPLogo is cleared. ISPLogoSize can also be used as a check to verify correct transfer and conversion of Base64 string to image size.

parameter.name: ISPMailServer
parameter.description: The URL of the ISP's mail server.

parameter.name: ISPNewsServer
parameter.description: The URL of the ISP's news server.

parameter.name: TextColor
parameter.description: The color of text on the GUI screens in RGB hexidecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: BackgroundColor
parameter.description: The color of the GUI screen backgrounds in RGB hexidecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: ButtonColor
parameter.description: The color of buttons on the GUI screens in RGB hexidecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: ButtonTextColor
parameter.description: The color of text on buttons on the GUI screens in RGB hexidecimal notation (e.g., FF0088).

parameter.name: AutoUpdateServer
parameter.description: The server the CPE can check to see if an update is available for direct download to it. This MUST NOT be used by the CPE if the {{param|.ManagementServer.UpgradesManaged}} parameter is {{true}}.

parameter.name: UserUpdateServer
parameter.description: The server where a user can check via a web browser if an update is available for download to a PC. This MUST NOT be used by the CPE if the {{param|.ManagementServer.UpgradesManaged}} parameter is {{true}}.

parameter.name: AvailableLanguages
parameter.description: Comma-separated list of user-interface languages that are available, where each language is specified according to RFC 3066 {{bibref|RFC3066}}.

parameter.name: CurrentLanguage
parameter.description: Current user-interface language, specified according to RFC 3066 {{bibref|RFC3066}}.

object.name: Device.UserInterface.RemoteAccess.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to remotely accessing the CPE's user interface. Remote access is defined as any entity not of a local subnet attempting to connect to the CPE. Remote access requires user authentication. To provide remote access authentication the CPE MUST support a {{object|.User.{i}.}} with at least one instance that has {{param|.User.{i}.RemoteAccessCapable}} set to {{true}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables/Disables remotely accessing the CPE’s user interface.

parameter.name: Port
parameter.description: Destination TCP port required for remote access connection.

parameter.name: SupportedProtocols
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the protocols that are supported by the CPE for the purpose of remotely accessing the user interface.

enumeration.description: As defined in {{bibref|RFC2616}}
As defined in {{bibref|RFC2818}}

parameter.name: Protocol
parameter.description: This is the protocol currently being used for remote access.

object.name: Device.UserInterface.LocalDisplay.
object.description: This object describes how to remotely manage the initial positioning of a user interface on a device's local display.

parameter.name: Movable
parameter.description: Controls whether the user is allowed to change the GUI window position on the local CPE's display.

parameter.name: Resizable
parameter.description: Controls whether the user is allowed to resize the GUI window on the local CPE's display.

parameter.name: PosX
parameter.description: The horizontal position of the User Interface's top left corner within the local CPE's display measured from the top left corner, expressed in {{units}}.

parameter.name: PosY
parameter.description: The vertical position of the User Interface's top left corner within the local CPE's display measured from the top left corner, expressed in {{units}}.

parameter.name: Width
parameter.description: The width of the user interface within the local CPE's display, expressed in {{units}}.

parameter.name: Height
parameter.description: The height of the user interface within the local CPE's display, expressed in {{units}}.

parameter.name: DisplayWidth
parameter.description: The width of the local CPE's display, expressed in {{units}}.

parameter.name: DisplayHeight
parameter.description: The height of the local CPE's display, expressed in {{units}}.

object.name: Device.LAN.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to IP-based LAN connectivity of a device. This object relates only to IP-layer LAN capabilities. Lower-layer aspects of LAN connectivity are not considered part of the common data model defined in this specification. For a device that contains multiple IP interfaces, the scope of this object is limited to the default IP interface. Data that might be associated with other interfaces is not considered part of the common data model defined in this specification.

parameter.name: AddressingType
parameter.description: The method used to assign an address to this interface. {{enum}} The ability to modify this parameter is OPTIONAL.

parameter.name: IPAddress
parameter.description: The current IP address assigned to this interface. The ability to modify this parameter is OPTIONAL, and this parameter cannot be modified if the {{param|AddressingType}} is {{enum|DHCP|AddressingType}}.

parameter.name: SubnetMask
parameter.description: The current subnet mask. The ability to modify this parameter is OPTIONAL, and this parameter cannot be modified if the {{param|AddressingType}} is {{enum|DHCP|AddressingType}}.

parameter.name: DefaultGateway
parameter.description: The IP address of the current default gateway for this interface. The ability to modify this parameter is OPTIONAL, and this parameter cannot be modified if the {{param|AddressingType}} is {{enum|DHCP|AddressingType}}.

parameter.name: DNSServers
parameter.description: Comma-separated list of IP address of the DNS servers for this interface. The ability to modify this parameter is OPTIONAL, and this parameter cannot be modified if the {{param|AddressingType}} is {{enum|DHCP|AddressingType}}. If this parameter is modifiable, the device MAY ignore any DNS servers beyond the first two in the list.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The physical address of this interface. Writable only if {{param|MACAddressOverride}} is present and equal to {{true}}.

parameter.name: MACAddressOverride
parameter.description: Whether the value of MACAddress parameter can be overridden. * When {{true}}, {{param|MACAddress}} is writable. * When {{false}}, {{param|MACAddress}} is not writable, and the default MAC address assigned by the device SHOULD be restored.

parameter.name: DHCPOptionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in the DHCP option table.

object.name: Device.LAN.DHCPOption.{i}.
object.description: This object is for configuration of DHCP options. Each instance of this object represents a DHCP option to be included by the DHCP client in client requests. The DHCP client MAY include any other options not specified in this table.

parameter.name: Request
parameter.description: Whether this entry represents a request to the DHCP server, or a value to be sent by the DHCP client. * When {{true}}, this entry represents a request. In this case, the DHCP client MUST include the specified {{param|Tag}} in the Parameter Request List, as defined in RFC 2132. The {{param|Value}} parameter is ignored in this case. * When {{false}}, this entry represents a value to be sent by the DHCP client. In this case, the DHCP client MUST include a DHCP option formed from the {{param|Tag}} and {{param|Value}} parameters (with the Length derived from the length of the {{param|Value}} parameter).

parameter.name: Tag
parameter.description: Tag of the DHCP option as defined in RFC 2132.

parameter.name: Value
parameter.description: Base64 encoded octet string to be used as the Value of the DHCP option if {{param|Request}} is {{false}}.

object.name: Device.LAN.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for the default IP interface.

parameter.name: ConnectionUpTime
parameter.description: The time in seconds that this IP interface has been connected. * If the IP interface is using DHCP, this is the time that the DHCP client has been only in the Bound or Renewing states and the lower-layer interface has continuously maintained a link. * If the IP interface is using static addressing, this is the time that the lower-layer interface has continuously maintained a link.

parameter.name: TotalBytesSent
parameter.description: Total number of IP payload bytes sent over this interface since the device was last restarted as specified in {{param|.DeviceInfo.UpTime}}.

parameter.name: TotalBytesReceived
parameter.description: Total number of IP payload bytes received over this interface since the device was last restarted as specified in {{param|.DeviceInfo.UpTime}}.

parameter.name: TotalPacketsSent
parameter.description: Total number of IP packets sent over this interface since the device was last restarted as specified in {{param|.DeviceInfo.UpTime}}.

parameter.name: TotalPacketsReceived
parameter.description: Total number of IP packets received over this interface since the device was last restarted as specified in {{param|.DeviceInfo.UpTime}}.

parameter.name: CurrentDayInterval
parameter.description: Number of seconds since the beginning of the period used for collection of CurrentDay statistics. The device MAY align the beginning of each CurrentDay interval with days in the UTC time zone, but does not need to do so.

parameter.name: CurrentDayBytesSent
parameter.description: Total number of IP payload bytes sent over this interface since the beginning of the current-day interval as specified by {{param|CurrentDayInterval}}.

parameter.name: CurrentDayBytesReceived
parameter.description: Total number of IP payload bytes received over this interface since the beginning of the current-day interval as specified by {{param|CurrentDayInterval}}.

parameter.name: CurrentDayPacketsSent
parameter.description: Total number of IP packets sent over this interface since the beginning of the current-day interval as specified by {{param|CurrentDayInterval}}.

parameter.name: CurrentDayPacketsReceived
parameter.description: Total number of IP packets received over this interface since the beginning of the current-day interval as specified by {{param|CurrentDayInterval}}.

parameter.name: QuarterHourInterval
parameter.description: Number of seconds since the beginning of the period used for collection of QuarterHour statistics. The device MAY align the beginning of each QuarterHour interval with real-time quarter-hour intervals, but does not need to do so.

parameter.name: QuarterHourBytesSent
parameter.description: Total number of IP payload bytes sent over this interface since the beginning of the quarter-hour interval as specified by {{param|QuarterHourInterval}}.

parameter.name: QuarterHourBytesReceived
parameter.description: Total number of IP payload bytes received over this interface since the beginning of the quarter-hour interval as specified by {{param|QuarterHourInterval}}.

parameter.name: QuarterHourPacketsSent
parameter.description: Total number of IP packets sent over this interface since the beginning of the quarter-hour interval as specified by {{param|QuarterHourInterval}}.

parameter.name: QuarterHourPacketsReceived
parameter.description: Total number of IP packets received over this interface since the beginning of the quarter-hour interval as specified by {{param|QuarterHourInterval}}.

object.name: Device.LAN.IPPingDiagnostics.
object.description: This object defines access to an IP-layer ping test for the default IP interface.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: Indicates availability of diagnostic data. {{enum}} If the ACS sets the value of this parameter to {{enum|Requested}}, the CPE MUST initiate the corresponding diagnostic test. When writing, the only allowed value is {{enum|Requested}}. To ensure the use of the proper test parameters (the writable parameters in this object), the test parameters MUST be set either prior to or at the same time as (in the same SetParameterValues) setting the {{param}} to {{enum|Requested}}. When requested, the CPE SHOULD wait until after completion of the communication session with the ACS before starting the diagnostic. When the test is completed, the value of this parameter MUST be either {{enum|Complete}} (if the test completed successfully), or one of the ''Error'' values listed above. If the value of this parameter is anything other than {{enum|Complete}}, the values of the results parameters for this test are indeterminate. When the diagnostic initiated by the ACS is completed (successfully or not), the CPE MUST establish a new connection to the ACS to allow the ACS to view the results, indicating the Event code ''8 DIAGNOSTICS COMPLETE'' in the Inform message. After the diagnostic is complete, the value of all result parameters (all read-only parameters in this object) MUST be retained by the CPE until either this diagnostic is run again, or the CPE reboots. After a reboot, if the CPE has not retained the result parameters from the most recent test, it MUST set the value of this parameter to {{enum|None}}. Modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the test being terminated and the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, setting this parameter to {{enum|Requested}} (and possibly modifying other writable parameters in this object) MUST result in the test being terminated and then restarted using the current values of the test parameters.

parameter.name: Host
parameter.description: Host name or address of the host to ping.

parameter.name: NumberOfRepetitions
parameter.description: Number of repetitions of the ping test to perform before reporting the results.

parameter.name: Timeout
parameter.description: Timeout in milliseconds for the ping test.

parameter.name: DataBlockSize
parameter.description: Size of the data block in bytes to be sent for each ping.

parameter.name: DSCP
parameter.description: DiffServ codepoint to be used for the test packets. By default the CPE SHOULD set this value to zero.

parameter.name: SuccessCount
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the number of successful pings (those in which a successful response was received prior to the timeout) in the most recent ping test.

parameter.name: FailureCount
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the number of failed pings in the most recent ping test.

parameter.name: AverageResponseTime
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the average response time in milliseconds over all repetitions with successful responses of the most recent ping test. If there were no successful responses, this value MUST be zero.

parameter.name: MinimumResponseTime
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the minimum response time in milliseconds over all repetitions with successful responses of the most recent ping test. If there were no successful responses, this value MUST be zero.

parameter.name: MaximumResponseTime
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the maximum response time in milliseconds over all repetitions with successful responses of the most recent ping test. If there were no successful responses, this value MUST be zero.

object.name: Device.LAN.TraceRouteDiagnostics.
object.description: This object is defines access to an IP-layer trace-route test for the default IP interface.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: Indicates availability of diagnostic data. {{enum}} If the ACS sets the value of this parameter to {{enum|Requested}}, the CPE MUST initiate the corresponding diagnostic test. When writing, the only allowed value is {{enum|Requested}}. To ensure the use of the proper test parameters (the writable parameters in this object), the test parameters MUST be set either prior to or at the same time as (in the same SetParameterValues) setting the {{param}} to {{enum|Requested}}. When requested, the CPE SHOULD wait until after completion of the communication session with the ACS before starting the diagnostic. When the test is completed, the value of this parameter MUST be either {{enum|Complete}} (if the test completed successfully), or one of the ''Error'' values listed above. If the value of this parameter is anything other than {{enum|Complete}}, the values of the results parameters for this test are indeterminate. When the diagnostic initiated by the ACS is completed (successfully or not), the CPE MUST establish a new connection to the ACS to allow the ACS to view the results, indicating the Event code ''8 DIAGNOSTICS COMPLETE'' in the Inform message. After the diagnostic is complete, the value of all result parameters (all read-only parameters in this object) MUST be retained by the CPE until either this diagnostic is run again, or the CPE reboots. After a reboot, if the CPE has not retained the result parameters from the most recent test, it MUST set the value of this parameter to {{enum|None}}. Modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the test being terminated and the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, setting this parameter to {{enum|Requested}} (and possibly modifying other writable parameters in this object) MUST result in the test being terminated and then restarted using the current values of the test parameters.

parameter.name: Host
parameter.description: Host name or address of the host to find a route to.

parameter.name: Timeout
parameter.description: Timeout in milliseconds for the trace route test.

parameter.name: DataBlockSize
parameter.description: Size of the data block in bytes to be sent for each trace route.

parameter.name: MaxHopCount
parameter.description: The maximum number of hop used in outgoing probe packets (max TTL). The default is 30 hops.

parameter.name: DSCP
parameter.description: DiffServ codepoint to be used for the test packets. By default the CPE SHOULD set this value to zero.

parameter.name: ResponseTime
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the response time in milliseconds the most recent trace route test. If a route could not be determined, this value MUST be zero.

parameter.name: NumberOfRouteHops
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the number of hops within the discovered route. If a route could not be determined, this value MUST be zero.

object.name: Device.LAN.TraceRouteDiagnostics.RouteHops.{i}.
object.description: Result parameter indicating the components of the discovered route. If a route could not be determined, there will be no instances of this object.

parameter.name: HopHost
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the Host Name or IP Address of a hop along the discovered route.

object.name: Device.Capabilities.
object.description: The capabilities of the device. This is a constant read-only object, meaning that only a firmware upgrade will cause these values to be altered.

object.name: Device.Capabilities.PerformanceDiagnostic.
object.description: The capabilities of the Performance Diagnostics (''DownloadDiagnostics'' and ''UploadDiagnostics'') for the device.

parameter.name: DownloadTransports
parameter.description: Supported ''DownloadDiagnostics'' transport protocols for a CPE device.

parameter.name: UploadTransports
parameter.description: Supported ''UploadDiagnostics'' transport protocols for a CPE device.

object.name: Device.DownloadDiagnostics.
object.description: This object defines the diagnostics configuration for a HTTP and FTP DownloadDiagnostics Test. Files received in the DownloadDiagnostics do not require file storage on the CPE device.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: Indicate the availability of diagnostic data. {{enum}} If the ACS sets the value of this parameter to {{enum|Requested}}, the CPE MUST initiate the corresponding diagnostic test. When writing, the only allowed value is {{enum|Requested}}. To ensure the use of the proper test parameters (the writable parameters in this object), the test parameters MUST be set either prior to or at the same time as (in the same SetParameterValues) setting the {{param}} to {{enum|Requested}}. When requested, the CPE SHOULD wait until after completion of the communication session with the ACS before starting the diagnostic. When the test is completed, the value of this parameter MUST be either {{enum|Completed}} (if the test completed successfully), or one of the ''Error'' values listed above. If the value of this parameter is anything other than {{enum|Completed}}, the values of the results parameters for this test are indeterminate. When the diagnostic initiated by the ACS is completed (successfully or not), the CPE MUST establish a new connection to the ACS to allow the ACS to view the results, indicating the Event code ''8 DIAGNOSTICS COMPLETE'' in the Inform message. After the diagnostic is complete, the value of all result parameters (all read-only parameters in this object) MUST be retained by the CPE until either this diagnostic is run again, or the CPE reboots. After a reboot, if the CPE has not retained the result parameters from the most recent test, it MUST set the value of this parameter to {{enum|None}}. Modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the test being terminated and the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, setting this parameter to Requested (and possibly modifying other writable parameters in this object) MUST result in the test being terminated and then restarted using the current values of the test parameters.

parameter.name: Interface
DownloadURL
parameter.description: The URL, as defined in {{bibref|RFC3986}}, for the CPE to perform the download on. This parameter MUST be in the form of a valid HTTP {{bibref|RFC2616}} or FTP {{bibref|RFC959}} URL. * When using FTP transport, FTP binary transfer MUST be used. * When using HTTP transport, persistent connections MUST be used and pipelining MUST NOT be used. * When using HTTP transport the HTTP Authentication MUST NOT be used.

parameter.name: DSCP
parameter.description: The DiffServ code point for marking packets transmitted in the test. The default value SHOULD be zero.

parameter.name: EthernetPriority
parameter.description: Ethernet priority code for marking packets transmitted in the test (if applicable). The default value SHOULD be zero.

parameter.name: ROMTime
parameter.description: Request time in UTC, which MUST be specified to microsecond precision. For example: 2008-04-09T15:01:05.123456 * For HTTP this is the time at which the client sends the GET command. * For FTP this is the time at which the client sends the RTRV command.

parameter.name: BOMTime
parameter.description: Begin of transmission time in UTC, which MUST be specified to microsecond precision For example: 2008-04-09T15:01:05.123456 * For HTTP this is the time at which the first data packet is received. * For FTP this is the time at which the client receives the first data packet on the data connection.

parameter.name: EOMTime
parameter.description: End of transmission in UTC, which MUST be specified to microsecond precision. For example: 2008-04-09T15:01:05.123456 * For HTTP this is the time at which the last data packet is received. * For FTP this is the time at which the client receives the last packet on the data connection.

parameter.name: TestBytesReceived
parameter.description: The test traffic received in bytes during the FTP/HTTP transaction including FTP/HTTP headers, between {{param|BOMTime}} and {{param|EOMTime}},

parameter.name: TotalBytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received on the Interface between {{param|BOMTime}} and {{param|EOMTime}}.

parameter.name: TCPOpenRequestTime
parameter.description: Request time in UTC, which MUST be specified to microsecond precision. For example: 2008-04-09T15:01:05.123456 * For HTTP this is the time at which the TCP socket open (SYN) was sent for the HTTP connection. * For FTP this is the time at which the TCP socket open (SYN) was sent for the data connection. Note: Interval of 1 microsecond SHOULD be supported.

parameter.name: TCPOpenResponseTime
parameter.description: Response time in UTC, which MUST be specified to microsecond precision. For example: 2008-04-09T15:01:05.123456 * For HTTP this is the time at which the TCP ACK to the socket opening the HTTP connection was received. * For FTP this is the time at which the TCP ACK to the socket opening the data connection was received. Note: Interval of 1 microsecond SHOULD be supported.

object.name: Device.UploadDiagnostics.
object.description: This object defines the diagnostics configuration for a HTTP or FTP UploadDiagnostics test. Files sent by the UploadDiagnostics do not require file storage on the CPE device, and MAY be an arbitrary stream of bytes.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: Indicate the availability of diagnostic data. {{enum}} If the ACS sets the value of this parameter to {{enum|Requested}}, the CPE MUST initiate the corresponding diagnostic test. When writing, the only allowed value is {{enum|Requested}}. To ensure the use of the proper test parameters (the writable parameters in this object), the test parameters MUST be set either prior to or at the same time as (in the same SetParameterValues) setting the {{param}} to {{enum|Requested}}. When requested, the CPE SHOULD wait until after completion of the communication session with the ACS before starting the diagnostic. When the test is completed, the value of this parameter MUST be either {{enum|Completed}} (if the test completed successfully), or one of the ''Error'' values listed above. If the value of this parameter is anything other than {{enum|Completed}}, the values of the results parameters for this test are indeterminate. When the diagnostic initiated by the ACS is completed (successfully or not), the CPE MUST establish a new connection to the ACS to allow the ACS to view the results, indicating the Event code ''8 DIAGNOSTICS COMPLETE'' in the Inform message. After the diagnostic is complete, the value of all result parameters (all read-only parameters in this object) MUST be retained by the CPE until either this diagnostic is run again, or the CPE reboots. After a reboot, if the CPE has not retained the result parameters from the most recent test, it MUST set the value of this parameter to {{enum|None}}. Modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the test being terminated and the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, setting this parameter to {{enum|Requested}} (and possibly modifying other writable parameters in this object) MUST result in the test being terminated and then restarted using the current values of the test parameters.

parameter.name: Interface
UploadURL
parameter.description: The URL, as defined in {{bibref|RFC3986}}, for the CPE to Upload to. This parameter MUST be in the form of a valid HTTP {{bibref|RFC2616}} or FTP {{bibref|RFC959}} URL. * When using FTP transport, FTP binary transfer MUST be used. * When using HTTP transport, persistent connections MUST be used and pipelining MUST NOT be used. * When using HTTP transport the HTTP Authentication MUST NOT be used.

parameter.name: DSCP
parameter.description: DiffServ code point for marking packets transmitted in the test. The default value SHOULD be zero.

parameter.name: EthernetPriority
parameter.description: Ethernet priority code for marking packets transmitted in the test (if applicable). The default value SHOULD be zero.

parameter.name: TestFileLength
parameter.description: The size of the file (in bytes) to be uploaded to the server. The CPE MUST insure the appropriate number of bytes are sent.

parameter.name: ROMTime
parameter.description: Request time in UTC, which MUST be specified to microsecond precision. For example: 2008-04-09T15:01:05.123456 * For HTTP this is the time at which the client sends the PUT command * For FTP this is the time at which the STOR command is sent.

parameter.name: BOMTime
parameter.description: Begin of transmission time in UTC, which MUST be specified to microsecond precision. For example: 2008-04-09T15:01:05.123456 * For HTTP this is the time at which the first data packet is sent. * For FTP this is the time at which the client receives the ready for transfer notification.

parameter.name: EOMTime
parameter.description: End of transmission in UTC, which MUST be specified to microsecond precision. For example: 2008-04-09T15:01:05.123456 * For HTTP this is the time when the HTTP successful response code is received. * For FTP this is the time when the client receives a transfer complete.

parameter.name: TotalBytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes sent on the Interface between {{param|BOMTime}} and {{param|EOMTime}}.

parameter.name: TCPOpenRequestTime
parameter.description: Request time in UTC, which MUST be specified to microsecond precision. For example: 2008-04-09T15:01:05.123456 * For HTTP this is the time at which the TCP socket open (SYN) was sent for the HTTP connection. * For FTP this is the time at which the TCP socket open (SYN) was sent for the data connection Note: Interval of 1 microsecond SHOULD be supported.

parameter.name: TCPOpenResponseTime
parameter.description: Response time in UTC, which MUST be specified to microsecond precision. For example: 2008-04-09T15:01:05.123456 * For HTTP this is the Time at which the TCP ACK to the socket opening the HTTP connection was received. * For FTP this is the Time at which the TCP ACK to the socket opening the Data connection was received. Note: Interval of 1 microsecond SHOULD be supported.

object.name: Device.UDPEchoConfig.
object.description: This object allows the CPE to be configured to perform the UDP Echo Service defined in {{bibref|RFC862}} and UDP Echo Plus Service defined in {{bibref|TR-143|Appendix A.1}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: MUST be enabled to receive UDP echo. When enabled from a disabled state all related timestamps, statistics and UDP Echo Plus counters are cleared.

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: {{reference|IP-layer interface over which the CPE MUST listen and receive UDP echo requests on}} The value of this parameter MUST be either a valid interface or {{empty}}. An attempt to set this parameter to a different value MUST be rejected as an invalid parameter value. If {{empty}} is specified, the CPE MUST listen and receive UDP echo requests on all interfaces. Note: Interfaces behind a NAT MAY require port forwarding rules configured in the Gateway to enable receiving the UDP packets.

parameter.name: SourceIPAddress
parameter.description: The Source IP address of the UDP echo packet. The CPE MUST only respond to a UDP echo from this source IP address.

parameter.name: UDPPort
parameter.description: The UDP port on which the UDP server MUST listen and respond to UDP echo requests.

parameter.name: EchoPlusEnabled
parameter.description: If {{true}} the CPE will perform necessary packet processing for UDP Echo Plus packets.

parameter.name: EchoPlusSupported
parameter.description: {{true}} if UDP Echo Plus is supported.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: Incremented upon each valid UDP echo packet received.

parameter.name: PacketsResponded
parameter.description: Incremented for each UDP echo response sent.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The number of UDP received bytes including payload and UDP header after the UDPEchoConfig is enabled.

parameter.name: BytesResponded
parameter.description: The number of UDP responded bytes, including payload and UDP header sent after the UDPEchoConfig is enabled.

parameter.name: TimeFirstPacketReceived
parameter.description: Time in UTC, which MUST be specified to microsecond precision. For example: 2008-04-09T15:01:05.123456, The time that the server receives the first UDP echo packet after the UDPEchoConfig is enabled.

parameter.name: TimeLastPacketReceived
parameter.description: Time in UTC, which MUST be specified to microsecond precision. For example: 2008-04-09T15:01:05.123456 The time that the server receives the most recent UDP echo packet.

object.name: Device.User.{i}.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to the user characteristics.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables/disables this user object instance. If the User being configured is currently accessing the device then a disable MUST apply to the next user session and the current user session MUST NOT be abruptly terminated.

parameter.name: RemoteAccessCapable
parameter.description: Allows this user to remotely access the UserInterface via the mechanism defined in {{object|.UserInterface.RemoteAccess.}}

parameter.name: Username
parameter.description: Name of the current user. MUST NOT be {{empty}} for an enabled entry.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: The user's password.

parameter.name: Language
parameter.description: String describing the default language for the local configuration interface, specified according to {{bibref|RFC3066}}. If {{empty}}, {{param|.UserInterface.CurrentLanguage}} is used.

object.name: Device.UPnP.
object.description: This object contains all UPnP related objects and parameters including Device and Discovery related objects and parameters.

object.name: Device.UPnP.Device.
object.description: Configuration Object for UPnP Access.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables/Disables UPnP support.

parameter.name: UPnPMediaServer
parameter.description: Enables/Disables UPnP Media Server.

parameter.name: UPnPMediaRenderer
parameter.description: Enables/Disables UPnP Media Renderer.

parameter.name: UPnPWLANAccessPoint
parameter.description: Enables/Disables UPnP Wireless Access Point.

parameter.name: UPnPQoSDevice
parameter.description: Enables/Disables UPnP QoS Device.

parameter.name: UPnPQoSPolicyHolder
parameter.description: Enables/Disables UPnP QoS Policy Holder.

parameter.name: UPnPIGD
parameter.description: Enables/Disables UPnP IGD.

object.name: Device.UPnP.Device.Capabilities.
object.description: This object defines what UPnP capabilities this device has.

parameter.name: UPnPArchitecture
parameter.description: Numeric value indicating the version of supported architecture for UPnP. A value of 0 indicates no support.

parameter.name: UPnPMediaServer
parameter.description: Numeric value indicating the supported revision for UPnP Media Server. A value of 0 indicates no support.

parameter.name: UPnPMediaRenderer
parameter.description: Numeric value indicating the supported revision for UPnP Media Renderer. A value of 0 indicates no support.

parameter.name: UPnPWLANAccessPoint
parameter.description: Numeric value indicating the supported revision for UPnP Wireless Access Point. A value of 0 indicates no support.

parameter.name: UPnPBasicDevice
parameter.description: Numeric value indicating the supported revision for UPnP Basic Device. A value of 0 indicates no support.

parameter.name: UPnPQoSDevice
parameter.description: Numeric value indicating the supported revision for UPnP Qos Device. A value of 0 indicates no support.

parameter.name: UPnPQoSPolicyHolder
parameter.description: Numeric value indicating the supported revision for UPnP Qos Policy Holder. A value of 0 indicates no support.

parameter.name: UPnPIGD
parameter.description: Numeric value indicating the supported revision for UPnP IGD. A value of 0 indicates no support.

object.name: Device.UPnP.Discovery.
object.description: UPnP {{bibref|UPnP-DAv1}} SSDP discovered root devices, embedded devices and embedded services. The CPE MAY, but need not, retain some or all of the information in this object across reboots.

parameter.name: RootDeviceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in RootDevice table.

parameter.name: DeviceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in Device table.

parameter.name: ServiceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in Service table.

object.name: Device.UPnP.Discovery.RootDevice.{i}.
object.description: UPnP root device table. This table contains an entry for each UPnP root device that has been discovered via SSDP.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of the UPnP root device. {{enum}} The ability to list inactive UPnP root devices is OPTIONAL. The length of time an inactive device remains listed in this table is a local matter to the CPE.

enumeration.description: Device is active and UPnP lease has not expired.
Device is inactive because UPnP lease has expired.
Device is inactive because byebye message was received.

parameter.name: UUID
USN
parameter.description: The value of the USN (Unique Service Name) header for this UPnP root device. Three discovery messages are sent for root devices, and this SHOULD be the value of the USN header of the following form: : ''uuid:device-UUID::urn:domain-name:device:deviceType:v'' SSDP is an unreliable protocol and it is possible that no discovery message containing the USN header of the above form was ever received. If so, one of the other two forms MAY be used: : ''uuid:device-UUID::upnp:rootdevice'' : ''uuid:device-UUID'' (for root device UUID)

parameter.name: LeaseTime
parameter.description: The UPnP root device lease time in {{units}}, extracted from the CACHE-CONTROL header.

parameter.name: Location
parameter.description: The value of the LOCATION header for this UPnP root device, which is the URL of the root device's DDD (Device Description Document).

parameter.name: Server
parameter.description: The value of the SERVER header for this UPnP root device, which is a string of the following form: : ''OS/version UPnP/udaversion product/version'' where '''UPnP''' is a literal string, '''udaversion''' is the version of the UPnP Device Architecture.

parameter.name: Host
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the full path names of all Host table entries, whether active or inactive, that correspond to this UPnP root device. As such entries are added to or removed from the Host tables, the value of this parameter MUST be updated accordingly.

object.name: Device.UPnP.Discovery.Device.{i}.
object.description: UPnP embedded device table. This table contains an entry for each UPnP embedded device that has been discovered via SSDP.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of the UPnP embedded device. {{enum}} The ability to list inactive UPnP embedded devices is OPTIONAL. The length of time an inactive device remains listed in this table is a local matter to the CPE.

enumeration.description: Device is active and UPnP lease has not expired.
Device is inactive because UPnP lease has expired.
Device is inactive because byebye message was received.

parameter.name: UUID
USN
parameter.description: The value of the USN (Unique Service Name) header for this UPnP embedded device. Two discovery messages are sent for embedded devices, and this SHOULD be the value of the USN header of the following form: : ''uuid:device-UUID::urn:domain-name:device:deviceType:v'' SSDP is an unreliable protocol and it is possible that no discovery message containing the USN header of the above form was ever received. If so, the other form MAY be used: : ''uuid:device-UUID''

parameter.name: LeaseTime
parameter.description: The UPnP embedded device lease time in {{units}}, extracted from the CACHE-CONTROL header.

parameter.name: Location
parameter.description: The value of the LOCATION header for this UPnP embedded device, which is the URL of the root device's DDD (Device Description Document).

parameter.name: Server
parameter.description: The value of the SERVER header for this UPnP embedded device, which is a string of the following form: : ''OS/version UPnP/udaversion product/version'' where '''UPnP''' is a literal string, '''udaversion''' is the version of the UPnP Device Architecture.

parameter.name: Host
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the full path names of all Host table entries, whether active or inactive, that correspond to this UPnP embedded device. As such entries are added to or removed from the Host tables, the value of this parameter MUST be updated accordingly.

object.name: Device.UPnP.Discovery.Service.{i}.
object.description: UPnP embedded service table. This table contains an entry for each UPnP embedded service that has been discovered via SSDP.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: The status of the UPnP embedded service. {{enum}} The ability to list inactive UPnP embedded services is OPTIONAL. The length of time an inactive service remains listed in this table is a local matter to the CPE.

enumeration.description: Service is active and UPnP lease has not expired.
Service is inactive because UPnP lease has expired.
Service is inactive because byebye message was received.

parameter.name: USN
parameter.description: The value of the USN (Unique Service Name) header for this UPnP embedded service. This is of the following form: : ''uuid:device-UUID::urn:domain-name:service:serviceType:v''

parameter.name: LeaseTime
parameter.description: The UPnP embedded service lease time in {{units}}, extracted from the CACHE-CONTROL header.

parameter.name: Location
parameter.description: The value of the LOCATION header for this UPnP embedded service, which is the URL of the root device's DDD (Device Description Document).

parameter.name: Server
parameter.description: The value of the SERVER header for this UPnP embedded service, which is a string of the following form: : ''OS/version UPnP/udaversion product/version'' where '''UPnP''' is a literal string, '''udaversion''' is the version of the UPnP Device Architecture.

parameter.name: Host
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the full path names of all Host table entries, whether active or inactive, that correspond to this UPnP embedded service. As such entries are added to or removed from the Host tables, the value of this parameter MUST be updated accordingly.

object.name: Device.DLNA.
object.description: This object contains all DLNA related objects and parameters.

object.name: Device.DLNA.Capabilities.
object.description: DLNA capabilities.

parameter.name: HNDDeviceClass
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the supported DLNA Home Network Device Classes {{bibref|DLNA-NDIG|Table 4-1}}.

parameter.name: DeviceCapability
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the supported DLNA Device Capabilities {{bibref|DLNA-NDIG|Table 4-2}}.

parameter.name: HIDDeviceClass
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the supported DLNA Home Infrastructure Device Classes {{bibref|DLNA-NDIG|Table 4-4}}.

parameter.name: ImageClassProfileID
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the DLNA Image Class Profile IDs supported by this device, from Tables 5-2 and 5-3 of {{bibref|DLNA-NDIG}}.

parameter.name: AudioClassProfileID
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the DLNA Audio Class Profile IDs supported by this device, from Tables 5-4 through 5-10 of {{bibref|DLNA-NDIG}}.

parameter.name: AVClassProfileID
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the DLNA AV Class Profile IDs supported by this device, from Tables 5-11 through 5-15 of {{bibref|DLNA-NDIG}}.

parameter.name: MediaCollectionProfileID
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the DLNA Media Collection Profile IDs supported by this device {{bibref|DLNA-NDIG|Table 5-16}}.

parameter.name: PrinterClassProfileID
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates the DLNA Printer Class Profile IDs supported by this device {{bibref|DLNA-NDIG|Table 5-17}}.

object.name: Device.SmartCardReader.{i}.
object.description: This object describes the characteristics of the smart card reader.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this smart card reader.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this smart card reader.

enumeration.description: Indicates the smart card reader is enabled and functioning properly.
Indicates the smart card reader is enabled and not functioning properly.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Human-readable name associated with this smart card reader.

parameter.name: Reset
parameter.description: When set to {{true}}, resets the SmartCard Reader and the associated SmartCard.

parameter.name: ResetTime
parameter.description: The time at which this SmartCard Reader was reset. Reset can be caused by: * {{param|Status}} transition from Disabled to Enabled * {{param|Reset}} set to {{true}}. * An internal reset of the SmartCard Reader (including a reboot of the device). Unknown Time value indicates that this SmartCard Reader has never been reset, which can only happen if it has never been enabled.

parameter.name: DecryptionFailedCounter
parameter.description: Counter incremented once each time decryption cannot be carried out. This counter relates to the smart card reader, not to the smart card itself, i.e. it is reset when the {{param|Reset}} parameter is used and not when a Smart Card is inserted or removed.

parameter.name: DecryptionFailedNoKeyCounter
parameter.description: Counter incremented once each time the key is not available to decrypt it. This is a subset of the more general {{param|DecryptionFailedCounter}} within the same object and thus will always be less than that parameter. This counter relates to the smart card reader, not to the smart card itself, i.e. it is reset when the {{param|Reset}} parameter is used and not when a Smart Card is inserted or removed.

object.name: Device.SmartCardReader.{i}.SmartCard.
object.description: Status of currently associated smart card.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Status of the Smart Card.

enumeration.description: Indicates that no Smart Card is inserted.
Indicates a Smart Card is present and working normally.
Indicates the Smart Card is present and in an error condition.

parameter.name: Type
parameter.description: Smart Card Type. {{enum}} Vendors can extend the enumerated values with vendor specific extensions, in which case the rules outlined in {{bibref|TR-106a2|Section 3.3}} MUST be adhered to.

parameter.name: Application
parameter.description: {{list}} Indicates Smart Card Application(s). {{param}} is only relevant when {{param|Type}} has a value of UICC, otherwise it is {{empty}}. {{enum}} Vendors can extend the enumerated values with vendor specific extensions, in which case the rules outlined in {{bibref|TR-106a2|Section 3.3}} MUST be adhered to.

parameter.name: SerialNumber
parameter.description: The Smart Card Serial Number or {{empty}} if the Smart Card serial Number is not available, e.g. in the case of IPTV due to restrictions of the Service Delivery Platform.

parameter.name: ATR
parameter.description: The Smart Card answer to a reset action. Issued by the Smart Card upon reset.

object.name: Device.SelfTestDiagnostics.
object.description: This diagnostics test is vendor-specific and MAY include testing hardware, software, and/or firmware.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: Indicates availability of diagnostic data. {{enum}} If the ACS sets the value of this parameter to {{enum|Requested}}, the CPE MUST initiate the corresponding diagnostic test. When writing, the only allowed value is {{enum|Requested}}. To ensure the use of the proper test parameters (the writable parameters in this object), the test parameters MUST be set either prior to or at the same time as (in the same SetParameterValues) setting the DiagnosticsState to Requested. When requested, the CPE SHOULD wait until after completion of the communication session with the ACS before starting the diagnostic. When the test is completed, the value of this parameter MUST be either {{enum|Complete}} (if the test completed successfully), or one of the Error values listed above. If the value of this parameter is anything other than {{enum|Complete}}, the values of the results parameters for this test are indeterminate. When the diagnostic initiated by the ACS is completed (successfully or not), the CPE MUST establish a new connection to the ACS to allow the ACS to view the results, indicating the Event code "8 DIAGNOSTICS COMPLETE" in the Inform message. After the diagnostic is complete, the value of all result parameters (all read-only parameters in this object) MUST be retained by the CPE until either this diagnostic is run again, or the CPE reboots. After a reboot, if the CPE has not retained the result parameters from the most recent test, it MUST set the value of this parameter to {{enum|None}}. Modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the test being terminated and the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, setting this parameter to {{enum|Requested}} (and possibly modifying other writable parameters in this object) MUST result in the test being terminated and then restarted using the current values of the test parameters.

parameter.name: Results
parameter.description: Results of self-test (vendor specific).

object.name: Device.NSLookupDiagnostics.
object.description: This object defines access to an IP-layer NS Lookup test for the specified IP interface. When initiated, the NS Lookup test will contact {{param|DNSServer}} and look up {{param|HostName}} {{param|NumberOfRepetitions}} times. There will be a {{object|Result}} instance for each time the device performs a DNS lookup, which is determined by the value of {{param|NumberOfRepetitions}}. Any previous {{object|Result}} instances are removed when a new test is initiated.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: Indicates availability of diagnostic data. {{enum}} If the ACS sets the value of this parameter to {{enum|Requested}}, the CPE MUST initiate the corresponding diagnostic test. When writing, the only allowed value is {{enum|Requested}}.
