parameter.description: This parameter SHALL contain the set of breakpoints exchanged in the MREFPSDus fields of the R-PRM message of G.993.2. Base64 encoded of the binary representation defined in Table 12-19/G.993.2 (maximum length is 145 octets, which requires 196 bytes for Base64 encoding).

parameter.name: LIMITMASK
parameter.description: Indicates the enabled VDSL2 Limit PSD mask of the selected PSD mask class. Bit mask as specified in ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. Note: For a VDSL2-capable multimode device operating in a mode other than VDSL2, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: US0MASK
parameter.description: Indicates the allowed VDSL2 US0 PSD masks for Annex A operation. Bit mask as specified in see ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. Note: For a VDSL2-capable multimode device operating in a mode other than VDSL2, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: LPATH
parameter.description: Reports the index of the latency path supporting the bearer channel. For single-latency connections, LPATH = 0. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: INTLVDEPTH
parameter.description: Reports the interleaver depth D for the latency path indicated in LPATH. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: INTLVBLOCK
parameter.description: Reports the interleaver block length in use on the latency path indicated in LPATH. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: ActualInterleavingDelay
parameter.description: Reports the actual delay, in milliseconds, of the latency path due to interleaving. Note: In G.997.1, this parameter is called "Actual Interleaving Delay." See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: ACTINP
parameter.description: Reports the actual impulse noise protection (INP) provided by the latency path indicated in LPATH. The value is the actual INP in the L0 (i.e., Showtime) state. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: INPREPORT
parameter.description: Reports whether the value reported in ACTINP was computed assuming the receiver does not use erasure decoding. Valid values are 0 (computed per the formula assuming no erasure decoding) and 1 (computed by taking into account erasure decoding capabilities of receiver). Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to {{false}}.

parameter.name: NFEC
parameter.description: Reports the size, in octets, of the Reed-Solomon codeword in use on the latency path indicated in LPATH. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: RFEC
parameter.description: Reports the number of redundancy bytes per Reed-Solomon codeword on the latency path indicated in LPATH. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: LSYMB
parameter.description: Reports the number of bits per symbol assigned to the latency path indicated in LPATH. This value does not include overhead due to trellis coding. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: TRELLISds
parameter.description: Reports whether trellis coding is enabled in the downstream direction. A value of 1 indicates that trellis coding is in use, and a value of 0 indicates that the trellis is disabled. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: TRELLISus
parameter.description: Reports whether trellis coding is enabled in the upstream direction. A value of 1 indicates that trellis coding is in use, and a value of 0 indicates that the trellis is disabled. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: ACTSNRMODEds
parameter.description: Reports whether the OPTIONAL virtual noise mechanism is in use in the downstream direction. A value of 1 indicates the virtual noise mechanism is not in use, and a value of 2 indicates the virtual noise mechanism is in use. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: ACTSNRMODEus
parameter.description: Reports whether the OPTIONAL virtual noise mechanism is in use in the upstream direction. A value of 1 indicates the virtual noise mechanism is not in use, and a value of 2 indicates the virtual noise mechanism is in use. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: VirtualNoisePSDds
parameter.description: Reports the virtual noise PSD for the downstream direction. Base64 encoded of the binary representation defined in G.997.1 by the parameter called TXREFVNds (maximum length is 97 octets, which requires 132 bytes for Base64 encoding). See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to {{empty}}.

parameter.name: VirtualNoisePSDus
parameter.description: Reports the virtual noise PSD for the upstream direction. Base64 encoded of the binary representation defined in G.997.1by the parameter called TXREFVNus (maximum length is 49 octets, which requires 68 bytes for Base64 encoding). See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to {{empty}}.

parameter.name: ACTUALCE
parameter.description: Reports the actual cyclic extension, as the value of m, in use for the connection. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 99.

parameter.name: SNRMpbus
parameter.description: The current signal-to-noise ratio margin of each upstream band. Interpretation of the values is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: SNRMpbds
parameter.description: The current signal-to-noise ratio margin of each band. Interpretation of the values is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: INMIATOds
parameter.description: The Impulse Noise Monitoring (INM) Inter Arrival Time (IAT) Offset, measured in DMT symbols, that the xTU receiver uses to determine in which bin of the IAT histogram the IAT is reported. Note: In G.997.1, this parameter is called INMIATO. See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: INMIATSds
parameter.description: The Impulse Noise Monitoring (INM) Inter Arrival Time (IAT) Step that the xTU receiver uses to determine in which bin of the IAT histogram the IAT is reported. Note: In G.997.1, this parameter is called INMIATS. See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: INMCCds
parameter.description: The Impulse Noise Monitoring (INM) Cluster Continuation value, measured in DMT symbols, that the xTU receiver uses in the cluster indication process. Note: In G.997.1, this parameter is called INMCC. See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: INMINPEQMODEds
parameter.description: The Impulse Noise Monitoring (INM) Equivalent Impulse Noise Protection (INP) Mode that the xTU receiver uses in the computation of the Equivalent INP. Note: In G.997.1, this parameter is called INM_INPEQ_MODE. See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for a WAN DSL physical interface.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.Stats.Total.
object.description: This object contains DSL total statistics.

parameter.name: ReceiveBlocks
parameter.description: Total number of successfully received blocks, where a block is as defined in RFC 2662 {{bibref|RFC2662}}. This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not available at either the G or the S/T interface.

parameter.name: TransmitBlocks
parameter.description: Total number of successfully transmitted blocks, where a block is as defined in RFC 2662 {{bibref|RFC2662}}. This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not available at either the G or the S/T interface.

parameter.name: CellDelin
parameter.description: Total number of cell-delineation errors (total seconds with NCD or LCD failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not available at either the G or the S/T interface.

parameter.name: LinkRetrain
parameter.description: Total number of link-retrain errors (Full Initialization Count as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not available at either the G or the S/T interface.

parameter.name: InitErrors
parameter.description: Total number of initialization errors (LINIT failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not defined in G.997.1.

parameter.name: InitTimeouts
parameter.description: Total number of initialization timeout errors.

parameter.name: LossOfFraming
parameter.description: Total number of loss-of-framing errors (LOF failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not defined in G.997.1.

parameter.name: ErroredSecs
parameter.description: Total number of errored seconds (ES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: SeverelyErroredSecs
parameter.description: Total number of severely errored seconds (SES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: FECErrors
parameter.description: Total number of FEC errors detected (FEC-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: ATUCFECErrors
parameter.description: Total number of FEC errors detected by the ATU-C (FEC-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: HECErrors
parameter.description: Total number of HEC errors detected (HEC-P as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: ATUCHECErrors
parameter.description: Total number of HEC errors detected by the ATU-C (HEC-PFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: CRCErrors
parameter.description: Total number of CRC errors detected (CV-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: ATUCCRCErrors
parameter.description: Total number of CRC errors detected by the ATU-C (CV-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: LInit
parameter.description: LInit is a flag to signal that a failure occurred as defined in G.997.1.

parameter.name: LOF
parameter.description: This parameter corresponds to LOF as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. LOF is a flag to signal that a failure occurred.

parameter.name: ATUCErroredSecs
parameter.description: Total number of errored seconds detected by the ATU-C (ES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1). Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: ATUCSeverelyErroredSecs
parameter.description: Total number of severely errored seconds detected by the ATU-C (SES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1). Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.Stats.Showtime.
object.description: This object contains DSL statistics accumulated since the most recent DSL Showtime.

parameter.name: ReceiveBlocks
parameter.description: Number of successfully received blocks since the most recent DSL Showtime, where a block is as defined in RFC 2662 {{bibref|RFC2662}}. This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not available at either the G or the S/T interface.

parameter.name: TransmitBlocks
parameter.description: Number of successfully transmitted blocks since the most recent DSL Showtime, where a block is as defined in RFC 2662 {{bibref|RFC2662}}. This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not available at either the G or the S/T interface.

parameter.name: CellDelin
parameter.description: Number of cell-delineation errors since the most recent DSL Showtime (total seconds with NCD or LCD failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not available at either the G or the S/T interface.

parameter.name: LinkRetrain
parameter.description: Number of link-retrain errors since the most recent DSL Showtime (Full Initialization Count as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not available at either the G or the S/T interface.

parameter.name: InitErrors
parameter.description: Number of initialization errors since the most recent DSL Showtime (LINIT failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not defined in G.997.1.

parameter.name: InitTimeouts
parameter.description: Number of initialization timeout errors since the most recent DSL Showtime.

parameter.name: LossOfFraming
parameter.description: Number of loss-of-framing errors since the most recent DSL Showtime (LOF failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not defined in G.997.1.

parameter.name: ErroredSecs
parameter.description: Number of errored seconds since the most recent DSL Showtime (ES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: SeverelyErroredSecs
parameter.description: Number of severely errored seconds since the most recent DSL Showtime (SES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: FECErrors
parameter.description: Number of FEC errors detected since the most recent DSL Showtime (FEC-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: ATUCFECErrors
parameter.description: Number of FEC errors detected by the ATU-C since the most recent DSL Showtime (FEC-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: HECErrors
parameter.description: Number of HEC errors detected since the most recent DSL Showtime (HEC-P as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: ATUCHECErrors
parameter.description: Number of HEC errors detected by the ATU-C since the most recent DSL Showtime (HEC-PFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: CRCErrors
parameter.description: Number of CRC errors detected since the most recent DSL Showtime (CV-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: ATUCCRCErrors
parameter.description: Number of CRC errors detected by the ATU-C since the most recent DSL Showtime (CV-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: LInit
parameter.description: LInit is a flag to signal that a failure occurred as defined in G.997.1.

parameter.name: LOF
parameter.description: This parameter corresponds to LOF as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. LOF is a flag to signal that a failure occurred.

parameter.name: ATUCErroredSecs
parameter.description: Number of errored seconds since the most recent DSL Showtime detected by the ATU-C (ES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1). Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: ATUCSeverelyErroredSecs
parameter.description: Number of severely errored seconds since the most recent DSL Showtime detected by the ATU-C (SES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1). Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: ReceiveBlocks

parameter.name: InitTimeouts

parameter.name: LossOfFraming

parameter.name: ErroredSecs
parameter.description: Number of errored seconds since the second most recent DSL Showtime (ES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1).{{np}}Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).
