object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.TestParams.
object.description: This object contains the DSL test parameters that are available during the L0 (i.e., Showtime) state.

parameter.name: HLOGGds
parameter.description: Number of sub-carriers per sub-carrier group in the downstream direction for {{param|HLOGpsds}}. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, and 8. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 1.

parameter.name: HLOGGus
parameter.description: Number of sub-carriers per sub-carrier group in the upstream direction for {{param|HLOGpsus}}. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, and 8. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 1.

parameter.name: HLOGpsds
parameter.description: Downstream logarithmic channel characteristics per sub-carrier group. The maximum number of elements is 256 for G.992.3, and 512 for G.992.5. For G.993.2, the number of elements will depend on the value of {{param|HLOGGds}} but will not exceed 512. Interpretation of the values is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to ''None''. Note: {{param}} is measured during initialization and is not updated during Showtime.

parameter.name: HLOGpsus
parameter.description: Upstream logarithmic channel characteristics per sub-carrier group. The maximum number of elements is 64 for G.992.3 and G.992.5. For G.993.2, the number of elements will depend on the value of {{param|HLOGGus}} but will not exceed 512. Interpretation of the values is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to ''None''. Note: {{param}} is measured during initialization and is not updated during Showtime.

parameter.name: HLOGMTds
parameter.description: Indicates the number of symbols over which {{param|HLOGpsds}} was measured. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: HLOGMTus
parameter.description: Indicates the number of symbols over which {{param|HLOGpsus}} was measured. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: QLNGds
parameter.description: Number of sub-carriers per sub-carrier group in the downstream direction for {{param|QLNpsds}}. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, and 8. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 1.

parameter.name: QLNGus
parameter.description: Number of sub-carriers per sub-carrier group in the upstream direction for {{param|QLNpsus}}. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, and 8. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 1.

parameter.name: QLNpsds
parameter.description: Downstream quiet line noise per subcarrier group. The maximum number of elements is 256 for G.992.3 and G.992.5. For G.993.2, the number of elements will depend on the value of {{param|QLNGds}} but will not exceed 512. Interpretation of the values is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter should be set to ''None''. Note: {{param}} is measured during initialization and is not updated during Showtime.

parameter.name: QLNpsus
parameter.description: Upstream quiet line noise per subcarrier group. The maximum number of elements is 64 for G.992.3 and G.992.5. For G.993.2, the number of elements will depend on the value of {{param|QLNGus}} but will not exceed 512. Interpretation of the values is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter should be set to ''None''. Note: {{param}} is measured during initialization and is not updated during Showtime.

parameter.name: QLNMTds
parameter.description: Indicates the number of symbols over which {{param|QLNpsds}} was measured. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: QLNMTus
parameter.description: Indicates the number of symbols over which {{param|QLNpsus}} was measured. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: SNRGds
parameter.description: Number of sub-carriers per sub-carrier group in the downstream direction for {{param|SNRpsds}}. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, and 8. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 1.

parameter.name: SNRGus
parameter.description: Number of sub-carriers per sub-carrier group in the upstream direction for {{param|SNRpsus}}. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, and 8. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 1.

parameter.name: SNRpsds
parameter.description: Downstream SNR per subcarrier group. The maximum number of elements is 256 for G.992.3, and 512 for G.992.5. For G.993.2, the number of elements will depend on the value of {{param|SNRGds}} but will not exceed 512. Interpretation of the values is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter should be set to ''None''. Note: {{param}} is first measured during initialization and is updated during Showtime.

parameter.name: SNRpsus
parameter.description: Upstream SNR per subcarrier group. The maximum number of elements is 64 for G.992.3 and G.992.5. For G.993.2, the number of elements will depend on the value of {{param|SNRGus}} but will not exceed 512. Interpretation of the values is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter should be set to ''None''. Note: {{param}} is first measured during initialization and is updated during Showtime.

parameter.name: SNRMTds
parameter.description: Indicates the number of symbols over which {{param|SNRpsds}} was measured. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: SNRMTus
parameter.description: Indicates the number of symbols over which {{param|SNRpsus}} was measured. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: LATNds
parameter.description: Downstream line attenuation per usable band, as computed during initialization. Number of elements is dependent on the number of downstream bands but will exceed one only for G.993.2. Interpretation of {{param}} is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: LATNus
parameter.description: Upstream line attenuation per usable band, as computed during initialization. Number of elements is dependent on the number of upstream bands but will exceed one only for G.993.2. Interpretation of {{param}} is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: SATNds
parameter.description: Downstream signal attenuation per usable band, as computed during the L0 (i.e., Showtime) state. Number of elements is dependent on the number of downstream bands but will exceed one only for G.993.2. Interpretation of {{param}} is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: SATNus
parameter.description: Upstream signal attenuation per usable band, as computed during the L0 (i.e., Showtime) state. Number of elements is dependent on the number of downstream bands but will exceed one only for G.993.2. Interpretation of {{param}} is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANEthernetInterfaceConfig.
object.description: This object models physical layer properties specific to a single Ethernet physical connection used for Internet access on a CPE. This object is required for a CPE with an Ethernet WAN interface, and is exclusive of any other ''WAN*InterfaceConfig'' object within a given ''WANDevice'' instance. Note that this object is not related to the Ethernet protocol layer sometimes used in associated with a DSL connection.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this interface.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this interface.{{np}}{{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The physical address of the interface.

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: The maximum upstream and downstream bit rate available to this connection.

parameter.name: DuplexMode
parameter.description: The duplex mode available to this connection.

parameter.name: ShapingRate
parameter.description: Rate to shape this connection's egress traffic to. For leaky bucket (constant rate shaping), this is the constant rate. For token bucket (variable rate shaping), this is the average rate. If <= 100, in percent of the rate of the highest rate-constrained layer over which the packet will travel on egress. If > 100, in bits per second. A value of -1 indicates no shaping. For example, for packets destined for a WAN DSL interface, if the ATM layer is rate-constrained, then the rate is calculated relative to this rate. Otherwise, the rate is calculated relative to the physical-layer DSL rate.

parameter.name: ShapingBurstSize
parameter.description: Burst size in bytes. For both leaky bucket (constant rate shaping) and token bucket (variable rate shaping) this is the bucket size and is therefore the maximum burst size.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANEthernetInterfaceConfig.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for an Ethernet WAN interface on a CPE device.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: Total number of bytes sent over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: Total number of bytes received over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: Total number of packets sent over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: Total number of packets received over the interface since the CPE was last reset.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLConnectionManagement.
object.description: This object is intended for a CPE with a DSL modem WAN interface. Note - This object was originally created to allow ''WANConnection'' devices and services to be added dynamically in the IGD object model in TR-064 because UPnP Device Architecture 1.0 did not contain this capability natively. Because in TR-069 objects can be created and removed using the AddObject and DeleteObject RPCs, ''WANConnection'' interfaces can be managed using these TR-069 mechanisms directly. Therefore, unlike the TR-064 equivalent, the {{object|ConnectionService}} table within this object is Read-Only in the TR-069 ''InternetGatewayDevice'' data model context. This object is OBSOLETED because it serves no purpose.

parameter.name: ConnectionServiceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of table entries in the ConnectionService table.{{np}}This parameter is OBSOLETED because it is within an OBSOLETED object. The CPE MAY return a value of 0 for this parameter, regardless of the number of connection services, in which case no {{object|ConnectionService}} instances will exist.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLConnectionManagement.ConnectionService.{i}.
object.description: This table contains an entry for each connection service.{{np}}This object is OBSOLETED because it is within an OBSOLETED object.

parameter.name: WANConnectionDevice
parameter.description: Specifies a WAN connection device object associated with this connection instance. The content is the full hierarchical parameter name of the WAN connection device. Example: ''InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.1.WANConnectionDevice.2''.{{np}}This parameter is OBSOLETED because it is within an OBSOLETED object.

parameter.name: WANConnectionService
parameter.description: Specifies a WAN connection object associated with this connection instance. The content is the full hierarchical parameter name of the layer 3 connection object. Example: ''InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.1.WANConnectionDevice.2.WANPPPConnection.1''. This parameter is OBSOLETED because it is within an OBSOLETED object.

parameter.name: DestinationAddress
parameter.description: Destination address of the WANConnectionDevice entry. One of: * ''PVC: VPI/VCI'' * ''SVC: ATM connection name'' * ''SVC: ATM address''{{np}}The "PVC:" or "SVC:" prefix is part of the parameter value and MUST be followed by 0 or 1 space characters. For example, possible values for this parameter are "PVC:8/23" or "PVC: 0/35". This parameter is OBSOLETED because it is within an OBSOLETED object.

parameter.name: LinkType
parameter.description: Link Type of the ''WANConnectionDevice'' entry. One of Link Types as described in ''WANDSLLinkConfig''. This parameter is OBSOLETED because it is within an OBSOLETED object.

parameter.name: ConnectionType
parameter.description: Connection Type of the ''WANPPPConnection'' or ''WANIPConnection'' entry. One of ''PossibleConnectionTypes'' as described in ''WAN**Connection'' service.{{np}}This parameter is OBSOLETED because it is within an OBSOLETED object.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: User-readable name of the connection.{{np}}This parameter is OBSOLETED because it is within an OBSOLETED object.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLDiagnostics.
object.description: This object is to provide diagnostic information for a CPE with an ADSL2 or ADSL2+ modem WAN interface, but MAY also be used for ADSL.

parameter.name: LoopDiagnosticsState
parameter.description: Indicates availability of diagnostic data. {{enum}} If the ACS sets the value of this parameter to {{enum|Requested}}, the CPE MUST initiate the corresponding diagnostic test, which brings down the DSL connection while the test is operating. When writing, the only allowed value is {{enum|Requested}}. When requested, the CPE SHOULD wait until after completion of the communication session with the ACS before starting the diagnostic. When the test is completed, the value of this parameter MUST be either {{enum|Complete}} (if the test completed successfully), or one of the ''Error'' values listed above. If the value of this parameter is anything other than {{enum|Complete}}, the values of the results parameters for this test are indeterminate. When the diagnostic initiated by the ACS is completed, the CPE MUST establish a new connection to the ACS to allow the ACS to view the results, indicating the corresponding reason in the Inform message. After the diagnostic is complete, the value of all result parameters (all read-only parameters in this object instance) MUST be retained by the CPE until either this diagnostic is run again, or the CPE reboots. After a reboot, if the CPE has not retained the result parameters from the most recent test, it MUST set the value of this parameter to {{enum|None}}.

parameter.name: ACTPSDds
parameter.description: Downstream actual power spectral density. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.{{np}}Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: ACTPSDus
parameter.description: Upstream actual power spectral density. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.{{np}}Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: ACTATPds
parameter.description: Downstream actual aggregate transmitter power. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.{{np}}Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: ACTATPus
parameter.description: Upstream actual aggregate transmitter power. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.{{np}}Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: HLINSCds
parameter.description: Downstream linear representation scale. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.{{np}}Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: HLINpsds
parameter.description: Downstream linear channel characteristics per subcarrier group. Maximum number of complex pairs is 256 for G.992.3, and 512 for G.992.5. For G.993.2, the number of pairs will depend on the value of {{param|HLINGds}} but will not exceed 512. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: HLIN is not applicable in PLOAM for G.992.1 or G.992.2. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to ''None''.

parameter.name: QLNpsds
parameter.description: Downstream quiet line noise per subcarrier group. Maximum number of elements is 256 for G.992.3, 512 for G.992.5. For G.993.2, the number of elements will depend on the value of {{param|QLNGds}} but will not exceed 512. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: QLN is not applicable in PLOAM for G.992.1 or G.992.2. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to ''None''.

parameter.name: SNRpsds
parameter.description: Downstream SNR per subcarrier group. Maximum number of elements is 256 for G.992.3, 512 for G.992.5. For G.993.2, the number of elements will depend on the value of {{param|SNRGds}} but will not exceed 512. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: SNRps is not applicable in PLOAM for G.992.1 or G.992.2. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to ''None''.

parameter.name: BITSpsds
parameter.description: Downstream bit allocation per subcarrier group. Maximum number of elements is 256 for G.992.3, 512 for G.992.5. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.

parameter.name: GAINSpsds
parameter.description: Downstream gain allocation per subcarrier group. Maximum number of elements is 256 for G.992.3, 512 for G.992.5. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. This parameter is DEPRECATED.

parameter.name: HLINSCus
parameter.description: Scaling used to represent the upstream linear channel characteristics. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: HLINGds
parameter.description: Number of sub-carriers per sub-carrier group in the downstream direction for {{param|HLINpsds}}. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, and 8. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 1.

parameter.name: HLINGus
parameter.description: Number of sub-carriers per sub-carrier group in the downstream direction for {{param|HLINpsus}}. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, and 8. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 1.

parameter.name: HLOGGds
parameter.description: Number of sub-carriers per sub-carrier group in the downstream direction for {{param|HLOGpsds}}. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, and 8. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 1.

parameter.name: HLOGGus
parameter.description: Number of sub-carriers per sub-carrier group in the upstream direction for {{param|HLOGpsus}}. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, and 8. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 1.

parameter.name: HLOGpsds
parameter.description: Downstream logarithmic channel characteristics per sub-carrier group. The maximum number of elements is 256 for G.992.3, and 512 for G.992.5. For G.993.2, the number of elements will depend on the value of {{param|HLOGGds}} but will not exceed 512. Interpretation of the values is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to ''None''. Note: {{param}} is measured during initialization and is not updated during Showtime.

parameter.name: HLOGpsus
parameter.description: Upstream logarithmic channel characteristics per sub-carrier group. The maximum number of elements is 64 for G.992.3 and G.992.5. For G.993.2, the number of elements will depend on the value of {{param|HLOGGus}} but will not exceed 512. Interpretation of the values is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to ''None''. Note: {{param}} is measured during initialization and is not updated during Showtime.

parameter.name: HLOGMTds
parameter.description: Indicates the number of symbols over which {{param|HLOGpsds}} was measured. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: HLOGMTus
parameter.description: Indicates the number of symbols over which {{param|HLOGpsus}} was measured. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: LATNpbds
parameter.description: Downstream line attenuation per usable band, as computed during initialization. Number of elements is dependent on the number of downstream bands but will exceed one only for G.993.2. Interpretation of {{param}} is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: LATNpbus
parameter.description: Upstream line attenuation per usable band, as computed during initialization. Number of elements is dependent on the number of upstream bands but will exceed one only for G.993.2. Interpretation of {{param}} is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: SATNds
parameter.description: Downstream signal attenuation per usable band, as computed during the L0 (i.e., Showtime) state. Number of elements is dependent on the number of downstream bands but will exceed one only for G.993.2. Interpretation of {{param}} is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: SATNus
parameter.description: Upstream signal attenuation per usable band, as computed during the L0 (i.e., Showtime) state. Number of elements is dependent on the number of downstream bands but will exceed one only for G.993.2. Interpretation of {{param}} is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: HLINpsus
parameter.description: Upstream linear channel characteristics per sub-carrier group. Maximum number of complex pairs is 64 for G.992.3, and G.992.5. For G.993.2, the number of pairs will depend on the value of {{param|HLINGus}} but will not exceed 512. Interpretation of the values is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: HLIN is not applicable in PLOAM for G.992.1 or G.992.2. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to ''None''.

parameter.name: QLNGds
parameter.description: Number of sub-carriers per sub-carrier group in the downstream direction for {{param|QLNpsds}}. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, and 8. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 1.

parameter.name: QLNGus
parameter.description: Number of sub-carriers per sub-carrier group in the upstream direction for {{param|QLNpsus}}. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, and 8. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 1.

parameter.name: QLNpsus
parameter.description: Upstream quiet line noise per subcarrier group. The maximum number of elements is 64 for G.992.3, and G.992.5. For G.993.2, the number of elements will depend on the value of {{param|QLNGus}} but will not exceed 512. Interpretation of the values is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: QLN is not applicable in PLOAM for G.992.1 or G.992.2. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to ''None''.

parameter.name: QLNMTds
parameter.description: Indicates the number of symbols over which {{param|QLNpsds}} was measured. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: QLNMTus
parameter.description: Indicates the number of symbols over which {{param|QLNpsus}} was measured. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: SNRGds
parameter.description: Number of sub-carriers per sub-carrier group in the downstream direction for {{param|SNRpsds}}. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, and 8. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 1.

parameter.name: SNRGus
parameter.description: Number of sub-carriers per sub-carrier group in the upstream direction for {{param|SNRpsus}}. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, and 8. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 1.

parameter.name: SNRpsus
parameter.description: Upstream SNR per subcarrier group. The maximum number of elements is 64 for G.992.3, and G.992.5. For G.993.2, the number of elements will depend on the value of {{param|SNRGus}} but will not exceed 512. Interpretation of the values is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: SNRps is not applicable in PLOAM for G.992.1 or G.992.2. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to ''None''.

parameter.name: SNRMTds
parameter.description: Indicates the number of symbols over which {{param|SNRpsds}} was measured. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: SNRMTus
parameter.description: Indicates the number of symbols over which {{param|SNRpsus}} was measured. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: BITSpsus
parameter.description: Upstream bit allocation per subcarrier group. Maximum number of elements is 256 for G.992.3, 512 for G.992.5. Interpretation of the value is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.
object.description: Each instance contains objects associated with a given WAN link. In the case of DSL, each instance corresponds to either a single ATM VC or a PTM Ethernet link. On creation of a ''WANConnectionDevice'' instance, there are initially no connection objects contained within. In the case of Ethernet (interface or link), only one ''WANConnectionDevice'' instance is supported.

parameter.name: WANIPConnectionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of instances of {{object|WANIPConnection}} in this ''WANConnectionDevice''.

parameter.name: WANPPPConnectionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of instances of {{object|WANPPPConnection}} in this ''WANConnectionDevice''.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANDSLLinkConfig.
object.description: This object models the ATM layer properties specific to a single physical connection of a DSL modem used for Internet access on a CPE. This object is intended for a CPE with a DSL modem WAN interface, and is exclusive of any other ''WAN*LinkConfig'' object within a given ''WANConnectionDevice'' instance.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the link. On creation of a ''WANConnectionDevice'', this object is disabled by default.

parameter.name: LinkStatus
parameter.description: Status of the link.

parameter.name: LinkType
parameter.description: Indicates the type of DSL connection and refers to the complete stack of protocol used for this connection. {{enum}} The value {{enum|PPPoE}} has always been DEPRECATED and {{enum|EoA}} SHOULD be used instead (see {{bibref|TR-098a2|Annex B}}). The ACS MUST NOT set this parameter to {{enum|PPPoE}} and the CPE MUST reject attempts to do so.

enumeration.description: RFC 2684 {{bibref|RFC2684}} bridged Ethernet over ATM
RFC 2684 {{bibref|RFC2684}} routed IP over ATM
RFC 2364 {{bibref|RFC2634}} PPP over ATM
RFC 2516 {{bibref|RFC2516}} PPP over Ethernet on RFC 2684 {{bibref|RFC2684}} bridged Ethernet over ATM
RFC 2225 {{bibref|RFC2225}} Classical IP over ATM

parameter.name: AutoConfig
parameter.description: Indicates if the CPE is currently using some auto configuration mechanisms for this connection. If this variable is {{true}}, all writable variables in this connection instance become read-only. Any attempt to change one of these variables SHOULD fail and an error SHOULD be returned.

parameter.name: ModulationType
parameter.description: Indicates the type of DSL modulation used on the interface associated with this connection (duplication from ''WANDSLInterfaceConfig'').

parameter.name: DestinationAddress
parameter.description: Destination address of this link. One of: * ''PVC: VPI/VCI'' * ''SVC: ATM connection name'' * ''SVC: ATM address''{{np}}The "PVC:" or "SVC:" prefix is part of the parameter value and MUST be followed by 0 or 1 space characters. For example, possible values for this parameter are "PVC:8/23" or "PVC: 0/35".

parameter.name: ATMEncapsulation
parameter.description: Identifies the connection encapsulation that will be used.

parameter.name: FCSPreserved
parameter.description: This flag tells if a checksum SHOULD be added in the ATM payload. It does not refer to the checksum of one of the ATM cells or AALX packets. In case of LLC or VCMUX encapsulation, this ATM checksum is the FCS field described in RFC 2684 {{bibref|RFC2684}}. It is only applicable in the upstream direction.

parameter.name: VCSearchList
parameter.description: Ordered list of VPI/VCI pairs to search if a link using the {{param|DestinationAddress}} cannot be established. In the form: : ''VPI1/VCI1, VPI2/VCI2, ...'' Example: : ''0/35, 8/35, 1/35''

parameter.name: ATMAAL
parameter.description: Describes the ATM Adaptation Layer (AAL) currently in use on the PVC.

parameter.name: ATMTransmittedBlocks
parameter.description: The current count of successfully transmitted cells.

parameter.name: ATMReceivedBlocks
parameter.description: The current count of successfully received cells.

parameter.name: ATMQoS
parameter.description: Describes the ATM Quality Of Service (QoS) being used on the VC.

parameter.name: ATMPeakCellRate
parameter.description: Specifies the upstream peak cell rate in cells per second.

parameter.name: ATMMaximumBurstSize
parameter.description: Specifies the upstream maximum burst size in cells.

parameter.name: ATMSustainableCellRate
parameter.description: Specifies the upstream sustainable cell rate, in cells per second, used for traffic shaping.

parameter.name: AAL5CRCErrors
parameter.description: Count of the AAL5 layer cyclic redundancy check errors.{{np}}This parameter is DEPRECATED because it overlaps with the {{param|ATMCRCErrors}} parameter. If present, it MUST have the same value as the {{param|ATMCRCErrors}} parameter if AAL5 is in use, or 0 if AAL5 is not in use.

parameter.name: ATMCRCErrors
parameter.description: Count of the ATM layer cyclic redundancy check (CRC) errors. This refers to CRC errors at the ATM adaptation layer (AAL). The AAL in use is indicated by the {{param|ATMAAL}} parameter. The value of the {{param}} parameter MUST be 0 for AAL types that have no CRCs.

parameter.name: ATMHECErrors
parameter.description: Count of the number of Header Error Check related errors at the ATM layer.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANATMF5LoopbackDiagnostics.
object.description: This object is provides access to an ATM-layer F5 OAM loopback test.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: Indicates availability of diagnostic data. {{enum}} If the ACS sets the value of this parameter to {{enum|Requested}}, the CPE MUST initiate the corresponding diagnostic test. When writing, the only allowed value is {{enum|Requested}}. To ensure the use of the proper test parameters (the writable parameters in this object), the test parameters MUST be set either prior to or at the same time as (in the same SetParameterValues) setting the {{param}} to {{enum|Requested}}. When requested, the CPE SHOULD wait until after completion of the communication session with the ACS before starting the diagnostic. When the test is completed, the value of this parameter MUST be either {{enum|Complete}} (if the test completed successfully), or one of the ''Error'' values listed above. If the value of this parameter is anything other than {{enum|Complete}}, the values of the results parameters for this test are indeterminate. When the diagnostic initiated by the ACS is completed (successfully or not), the CPE MUST establish a new connection to the ACS to allow the ACS to view the results, indicating the Event code ''8 DIAGNOSTICS COMPLETE'' in the Inform message. After the diagnostic is complete, the value of all result parameters (all read-only parameters in this object instance) MUST be retained by the CPE until either this diagnostic is run again, or the CPE reboots. After a reboot, if the CPE has not retained the result parameters from the most recent test, it MUST set the value of this parameter to {{enum|None}}. Modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the test being terminated and the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, setting this parameter to {{enum|Requested}} (and possibly modifying other writable parameters in this object) MUST result in the test being terminated and then restarted using the current values of the test parameters.

parameter.name: NumberOfRepetitions
parameter.description: Number of repetitions of the ping test to perform before reporting the results.

parameter.name: Timeout
parameter.description: Timeout in milliseconds for the ping test.

parameter.name: SuccessCount
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the number of successful pings (those in which a successful response was received prior to the timeout) in the most recent ping test.

parameter.name: FailureCount
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the number of failed pings in the most recent ping test.

parameter.name: AverageResponseTime
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the average response time in milliseconds over all repetitions with successful responses of the most recent ping test. If there were no successful responses, this value MUST be zero.

parameter.name: MinimumResponseTime
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the minimum response time in milliseconds over all repetitions with successful responses of the most recent ping test. If there were no successful responses, this value MUST be zero.

parameter.name: MaximumResponseTime
parameter.description: Result parameter indicating the maximum response time in milliseconds over all repetitions with successful responses of the most recent ping test. If there were no successful responses, this value MUST be zero.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANPTMLinkConfig.
object.description: This object models the PTM layer properties specific to a layer 2 interface of a DSL modem used for Internet access on a CPE. This object is intended for a CPE with a DSL modem WAN interface, and is exclusive of any other ''WAN*LinkConfig'' object within a given ''WANConnectionDevice'' instance. The PTM Link Layer object exists when the ''WANDSLInterfaceConfig'' ''LinkEncapsulationSupported'' parameter includes any of: * ''G.992.3_Annex_K_PTM'' * ''G.993.2_Annex_K_PTM'' * ''G.994.1''

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the link. On creation of a ''WANConnectionDevice'', this object is disabled by default.

parameter.name: LinkStatus
parameter.description: Status of the link.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The physical address of the interface.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANPTMLinkConfig.Stats.
object.description: This object represents the statistics collected and returned over a PTM link.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received on the interface, including framing characters. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: FramesSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets (frames) transmitted out of the interface. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: FramesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets (frames) which were received on this interface. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: OOSNearEnd
parameter.description: Indication that the CPE has detected the link is Out of Synchronization since the CPE rebooted or the interface was last enabled.

parameter.name: OOSFarEnd
parameter.description: Indication that the remote device has detected the link is Out of Synchronization since the CPE rebooted or the interface was last enabled.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address, including those that were discarded or not sent. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were addressed to a multicast address, including those that were discarded or not sent. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were addressed to a multicast address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were addressed to a broadcast address, including those that were discarded or not sent. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were addressed to a broadcast address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANEthernetLinkConfig.
object.description: This object models the Ethernet link layer properties specific to a single physical connection used for Internet access on a CPE. This object is intended for a CPE with an Ethernet WAN interface, and is exclusive of any other ''WAN*LinkConfig'' object within a given ''WANConnectionDevice'' instance. Note that this object is not related to the Ethernet protocol layer sometimes used in associated with a DSL connection.

parameter.name: EthernetLinkStatus
parameter.description: Status of the Ethernet link.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANPOTSLinkConfig.
object.description: This object models the POTS link layer properties specific to a single physical connection used for Internet access on a CPE. This object is intended for a CPE with a POTS WAN interface, and is exclusive of any other ''WAN*LinkConfig'' object within a given ''WANConnectionDevice'' instance.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the link. On creation of a ''WANConnectionDevice'', this object is disabled by default.

parameter.name: LinkStatus
parameter.description: Status of the link.

parameter.name: ISPPhoneNumber
parameter.description: Specifies a list of strings separated by semicolon (;), each string representing a phone number to connect to a particular ISP. The digits of the phone number follow the semantics of the ITU-T E.164 specification. Delimiters such as brackets or hyphens between the digits of a phone number are to be ignored by the CPE.

parameter.name: ISPInfo
parameter.description: Information identifying the Internet Service Provider. The format of the string is vendor specific.

parameter.name: LinkType
parameter.description: This variable indicates the type of POTS link used for the dialup connection.

parameter.name: NumberOfRetries
parameter.description: The number of times the CPE SHOULD attempt an Internet connection setup before returning error.

parameter.name: DelayBetweenRetries
parameter.description: The number of seconds the CPE SHOULD wait between attempts to setup an Internet connection.

parameter.name: Fclass
parameter.description: Specifies capabilities of the POTS modem - i.e., if it handles data ({{enum|0}}), fax ({{enum|1}},{{enum|2}},{{enum|2.0}}), voice ({{enum|8}}), DSVD ({{enum|80}}).

parameter.name: DataModulationSupported
parameter.description: The modulation standard currently being used for data.

parameter.name: DataProtocol
parameter.description: The protocol standard currently being used for data transfers.

parameter.name: DataCompression
parameter.description: The compression technology implemented on the modem.

parameter.name: PlusVTRCommandSupported
parameter.description: Capability for full duplex operation with data and voice.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANIPConnection.{i}.
object.description: This object enables configuration of IP connections on the WAN interface of a CPE.{{np}}If the ''Layer2Bridging'' object is implemented, the view that it provides of the CPE's underlying bridging configuration MUST be consistent with the view provided by any ''LANDevice'' and ''WAN**Connection'' objects. The implications of this are explained in {{bibref|TR-098a2|Annex A.6}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the connection instance. On creation of a ''WANIPConnection'' instance, it is initially disabled.

parameter.name: Reset
parameter.description: When set to {{true}}, the device MUST tear down the existing IP connection represented by this object and establish a new one. The device MUST initiate the reset after completion of the current CWMP session. The device MAY delay resetting the connection in order to avoid interruption of a user service such as an ongoing voice call. When read, this parameter always returns {{false}}.

parameter.name: ConnectionStatus
parameter.description: Current status of the connection.{{np}}{{enum}} The value {{enum|Disconneting}} is DEPRECATED because it is a typo. The ACS MUST treat {{enum|Disconneting}} and {{enum|Disconnecting}} the same.

parameter.name: PossibleConnectionTypes
parameter.description: Types of connections possible for this connection instance.

parameter.name: ConnectionType
parameter.description: Specifies the connection type of the connection instance.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: User-readable name of this connection.

parameter.name: Uptime
parameter.description: The time in seconds that this connection has been up.

parameter.name: LastConnectionError
parameter.description: The cause of failure for the last connection setup attempt.

parameter.name: AutoDisconnectTime
parameter.description: The time in seconds since the establishment of the connection after which connection termination is automatically initiated by the CPE. This occurs irrespective of whether the connection is being used or not. A value of 0 (zero) indicates that the connection is not to be shut down automatically.

parameter.name: IdleDisconnectTime
parameter.description: The time in seconds that if the connection remains idle, the CPE automatically terminates the connection. A value of 0 (zero) indicates that the connection is not to be shut down automatically.

parameter.name: WarnDisconnectDelay
parameter.description: Time in seconds the Status remains in the pending disconnect state before transitioning to disconnecting state to drop the connection.

parameter.name: RSIPAvailable
parameter.description: Indicates if Realm-specific IP (RSIP) is available as a feature on the CPE.

parameter.name: NATEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates if Network Address Translation (NAT) is enabled for this connection.

parameter.name: AddressingType
parameter.description: The method used to assign an address to the WAN side interface of the CPE for this connection.

parameter.name: ExternalIPAddress
parameter.description: This is the external IP address used by NAT for this connection. This parameter is configurable only if the {{param|AddressingType}} is {{enum|Static|AddressingType}}.

parameter.name: SubnetMask
parameter.description: Subnet mask of the WAN interface. This parameter is configurable only if the {{param|AddressingType}} is {{enum|Static|AddressingType}}.

parameter.name: DefaultGateway
parameter.description: The IP address of the default gateway for this connection. This parameter is configurable only if the {{param|AddressingType}} is {{enum|Static|AddressingType}}.

parameter.name: DNSEnabled
parameter.description: Whether or not the device SHOULD attempt to query a DNS server across this connection.

parameter.name: DNSOverrideAllowed
parameter.description: Whether or not a manually set, non-empty DNS address can be overridden by a DNS entry received from the WAN.

parameter.name: DNSServers
parameter.description: DNS server IP addresses for this connection. Support for more than three DNS Servers is OPTIONAL.

parameter.name: MaxMTUSize
parameter.description: The maximum allowed size of an Ethernet frame from LAN-side devices.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The physical address of the ''WANIPConnection'' if applicable. Configurable only if {{param|MACAddressOverride}} is present and {{true}}.

parameter.name: MACAddressOverride
parameter.description: Whether the value of {{param|MACAddress}} parameter can be overridden. If {{false}}, the CPE's default value is used (or restored if it had previously been overridden).

parameter.name: ConnectionTrigger
parameter.description: Trigger used to establish the IP connection.{{np}}{{enum}} The above values are defined as follows: * {{enum|OnDemand}}: If this IP connection is disconnected for any reason, it is to remain disconnected until the CPE has one or more packets to communicate over this connection, at which time the CPE automatically attempts to reestablish the connection. * {{enum|AlwaysOn}}: If this IP connection is disconnected for any reason, the CPE automatically attempts to reestablish the connection (and continues to attempt to reestablish the connection as long it remains disconnected). * {{enum|Manual}}: If this IP connection is disconnected for any reason, it is to remain disconnected until the user of the CPE explicitly instructs the CPE to reestablish the connection. Note that the reason for an IP connection becoming disconnected to begin with might be either external to the CPE, such as non-renewal of a DHCP lease or momentary disconnection of the physical interface, or internal to the CPE, such as use of the {{param|IdleDisconnectTime}} and/or {{param|AutoDisconnectTime}} parameters in this object. Note also that the means by which a CPE would keep an IP connection disconnected (while waiting for the designated trigger) if it is otherwise physically connected and has an IP address is a local matter specific to the implementation of the CPE.

parameter.name: RouteProtocolRx
parameter.description: Defines the Rx protocol to be used.

parameter.name: PortMappingNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Total number of port mapping entries.

parameter.name: ShapingRate
parameter.description: Rate to shape this connection's egress traffic to. For leaky bucket (constant rate shaping), this is the constant rate. For token bucket (variable rate shaping), this is the average rate. If <= 100, in percent of the rate of the highest rate-constrained layer over which the packet will travel on egress. If > 100, in bits per second. A value of -1 indicates no shaping. For example, for packets destined for a WAN DSL interface, if the ATM layer is rate-constrained, then the rate is calculated relative to this rate. Otherwise, the rate is calculated relative to the physical-layer DSL rate.

parameter.name: ShapingBurstSize
parameter.description: Burst size in bytes. For both leaky bucket (constant rate shaping) and token bucket (variable rate shaping) this is the bucket size and is therefore the maximum burst size.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANIPConnection.{i}.PortMapping.{i}.
object.description: Port mapping table. This table MUST contain all NAT port mappings associated with this connection, including static and dynamic port mappings programmatically created via local control protocol, such as UPnP. This table MUST NOT contain dynamic NAT binding entries associated with the normal operation of NAT. At most one entry in an instance of this table can exist with all of the same values for {{param|RemoteHost}}, {{param|ExternalPort}}, and {{param|PortMappingProtocol}}. If the ACS attempts to set the parameters of an existing entry such that this requirement would be violated, the CPE MUST reject the request. In this case, the SetParameterValues response MUST include a SetParameterValuesFault element for each parameter in the corresponding request whose modification would have resulted in such a violation. On creation of a new table entry, the CPE MUST choose default values for {{param|ExternalPort}} and {{param|PortMappingProtocol}} such that the new entry does not conflict with any existing entry.

parameter.name: PortMappingEnabled
parameter.description: Enables or disables the port mapping instance. On creation, an entry is disabled by default.

parameter.name: PortMappingLeaseDuration
parameter.description: Determines the time to live, in seconds, of a port-mapping lease, where "time to live" means the number of seconds before the port mapping expires. A value of 0 means the port mapping is static. Support for dynamic (non-static) port mappings is OPTIONAL. That is, the only value for {{param}} that MUST be supported is 0. For a dynamic (non-static) port mapping, when this parameter is read, the value represents the time remaining on the port-mapping lease. That is, for a dynamic port mapping, the value counts down toward 0. When a dynamic port-mapping lease expires, the CPE MUST automatically terminate that port mapping, and MUST automatically delete the corresponding ''PortMapping'' table entry.

parameter.name: RemoteHost
ExternalPort
InternalPort
parameter.description: The port on {{param|InternalClient}} that the gateway SHOULD forward connection requests to. A value of zero (0) is not allowed.

parameter.name: PortMappingProtocol
parameter.description: The protocol of the port mapping.{{np}}{{enum}} At most one entry in this table can exist with all of the same values for {{param|RemoteHost}}, {{param|ExternalPort}}, and {{param}}.

parameter.name: InternalClient
parameter.description: The IP address or DNS host name of an internal client (on the LAN). Support for an IP address is mandatory. If {{param}} is specified as an IP address and the LAN device's IP address subsequently changes, the port mapping MUST remain associated with the original IP address. Support for DNS host names is OPTIONAL. If {{param}} is specified as a DNS host name and the LAN device's IP address subsequently changes, the port mapping MUST remain associated with this LAN device. In this case, it is the responsibility of the CPE to maintain the name-to-address mapping in the event of IP address changes. This can be accomplished, for example, by assigning the DNS host name via use of DHCP option 12 (Host Name) or option 81 (FQDN). Note that the ACS can learn the host name associated with a given LAN device via the ''Hosts'' table ({{object|InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.Hosts}}). Read access to this parameter MUST always return the exact value that was last set by the ACS. For example, if the internal client is set to a DNS host name, it MUST read back as a DNS host name and not as an IP address. {{empty}} indicates an unconfigured {{param}}. If this parameter is unconfigured, this port mapping MUST NOT be operational. It MUST be possible to set the {{param}} to the broadcast IP address 255.255.255.255 for UDP mappings. This is to enable multiple NAT clients to use the same well-known port simultaneously.

parameter.name: PortMappingDescription
parameter.description: User-readable description of this port mapping.

parameter.name: ExternalPortEndRange
parameter.description: Indicates the last port of the external port range that starts with {{param|ExternalPort}}. If an external port range is specified, then the behavior described for {{param|ExternalPort}} applies to all ports within the range. A value of zero (0) indicates that no external port range is specified, i.e. that the range consists only of {{param|ExternalPort}}. If {{param|ExternalPort}} is zero (wildcard), the value of this parameter MUST be ignored. If specified, the value of this parameter MUST be greater than or equal to the value of {{param|ExternalPort}}.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANIPConnection.{i}.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The contents of this object SHOULD be identical for each such connection. This object is intended only for ''WANConnectionDevice''s that can support an Ethernet-layer on this interface (e.g., ''PPPoE'', ''IPoE'').

parameter.name: EthernetBytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted, including framing characters, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetBytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received, including framing characters, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets which were received over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetUnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address, including those that were discarded or not sent, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetUnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetDiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetDiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetMulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission, including those that were discarded or not sent, which were addressed to a multicast address, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetMulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were addressed to a multicast address, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetBroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission, including those that were discarded or not sent, which were addressed to a broadcast address, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetBroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were addressed to a broadcast address, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetUnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol, received over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANPPPConnection.{i}.
object.description: This object enables configuration of PPP connections on the WAN interface of a CPE.{{np}}If the ''Layer2Bridging'' object is implemented, the view that it provides of the CPE's underlying bridging configuration MUST be consistent with the view provided by any ''LANDevice'' and ''WAN**Connection'' objects. The implications of this are explained in {{bibref|TR-098a2|Annex A.6}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the connection instance. On creation of a ''WANPPPConnection'' instance, it is initially disabled.

parameter.name: Reset
parameter.description: When set to {{true}}, the device MUST tear down the existing PPP connection represented by this object and establish a new one. The device MUST initiate the reset after completion of the current CWMP session. The device MAY delay resetting the connection in order to avoid interruption of a user service such as an ongoing voice call. When read, this parameter always returns {{false}}.

parameter.name: ConnectionStatus
parameter.description: Current status of the connection.

parameter.name: PossibleConnectionTypes
parameter.description: Types of connections possible for this connection instance.

parameter.name: ConnectionType
parameter.description: Specifies the connection type of the connection instance.

parameter.name: PPPoESessionID
parameter.description: Represents the PPPoE Session ID.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: User-readable name of this connection.

parameter.name: Uptime
parameter.description: The time in seconds that this connection has been up.

parameter.name: LastConnectionError
parameter.description: The cause of failure for the last connection setup attempt.

parameter.name: AutoDisconnectTime
parameter.description: The time in seconds since the establishment of the connection after which connection termination is automatically initiated by the CPE. This occurs irrespective of whether the connection is being used or not. A value of 0 (zero) indicates that the connection is not to be shut down automatically.

parameter.name: IdleDisconnectTime
parameter.description: The time in seconds that if the connection remains idle, the CPE automatically terminates the connection. A value of 0 (zero) indicates that the connection is not to be shut down automatically.

parameter.name: WarnDisconnectDelay
parameter.description: Time in seconds the Status remains in the pending disconnect state before transitioning to disconnecting state to drop the connection.

parameter.name: RSIPAvailable
parameter.description: Indicates if Realm-specific IP (RSIP) is available as a feature on the CPE.

parameter.name: NATEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates if Network Address Translation (NAT) is enabled for this connection.

parameter.name: Username
parameter.description: Username to be used for authentication.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: Password to be usef for authentication.

parameter.name: PPPEncryptionProtocol
parameter.description: Describes the PPP encryption protocol used between the WAN device and the ISP POP.

parameter.name: PPPCompressionProtocol
parameter.description: Describes the PPP compression protocol used between the WAN device and the ISP POP.

parameter.name: PPPAuthenticationProtocol
parameter.description: Describes the PPP authentication protocol used between the WAN device and the ISP POP.

parameter.name: ExternalIPAddress
parameter.description: This is the external IP address used by NAT for this connection.

parameter.name: RemoteIPAddress
parameter.description: The remote IP address for this connection.

parameter.name: MaxMRUSize
parameter.description: The maximum allowed size of frames sent from the remote peer.

parameter.name: CurrentMRUSize
parameter.description: The current MRU in use over this connection.

parameter.name: DNSEnabled
parameter.description: Whether or not the device SHOULD attempt to query a DNS server across this connection.

parameter.name: DNSOverrideAllowed
parameter.description: Whether or not a manually set, non-empty DNS address can be overridden by a DNS entry received from the WAN.

parameter.name: DNSServers
parameter.description: DNS server IP addresses for this connection. Support for more than three DNS Servers is OPTIONAL.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The physical address of the ''WANPPPConnection'' if applicable. Configurable only if {{param|MACAddressOverride}} is present and {{true}}.{{np}}If {{param|TransportType}} is {{enum|PPPoA|TransportType}}, the value of this parameter is irrelevant and MUST be {{empty}}.

parameter.name: MACAddressOverride
parameter.description: Whether the value of {{param|MACAddress}} parameter can be overridden. If {{false}}, the CPE's default value is used (or restored if it had previously been overridden).{{np}}If {{param|TransportType}} is {{enum|PPPoA|TransportType}}, the value of this parameter is irrelevant and MUST be {{false}}.

parameter.name: TransportType
parameter.description: PPP transport type of the connection.

enumeration.description: for future use
for future use

parameter.name: PPPoEACName
parameter.description: PPPoE Access Concentrator.

parameter.name: PPPoEServiceName
parameter.description: PPPoE Service Name.

parameter.name: ConnectionTrigger
parameter.description: Trigger used to establish the PPP connection. {{enum}} The above values are defined as follows: * {{enum|OnDemand}}: If this PPP connection is disconnected for any reason, it is to remain disconnected until the CPE has one or more packets to communicate over this connection, at which time the CPE automatically attempts to reestablish the connection. * {{enum|AlwaysOn}}: If this PPP connection is disconnected for any reason, the CPE automatically attempts to reestablish the connection (and continues to attempt to reestablish the connection as long it remains disconnected). * {{enum|Manual}}: If this PPP connection is disconnected for any reason, it is to remain disconnected until the user of the CPE explicitly instructs the CPE to reestablish the connection. Note that the reason for a PPP connection becoming disconnected to begin with might be either external to the CPE, such as termination by the BRAS or momentary disconnection of the physical interface, or internal to the CPE, such as use of the {{param|IdleDisconnectTime}} and/or {{param|AutoDisconnectTime}} parameters in this object.

parameter.name: RouteProtocolRx
parameter.description: Defines the Rx protocol to be used.

parameter.name: PPPLCPEcho
parameter.description: PPP LCP Echo period in seconds.

parameter.name: PPPLCPEchoRetry
parameter.description: Number of PPP LCP Echo retries within an echo period.

parameter.name: PortMappingNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Total number of port mapping entries.

parameter.name: ShapingRate
parameter.description: Rate to shape this connection's egress traffic to. For leaky bucket (constant rate shaping), this is the constant rate. For token bucket (variable rate shaping), this is the average rate. If <= 100, in percent of the rate of the highest rate-constrained layer over which the packet will travel on egress. If > 100, in bits per second. A value of -1 indicates no shaping. For example, for packets destined for a WAN DSL interface, if the ATM layer is rate-constrained, then the rate is calculated relative to this rate. Otherwise, the rate is calculated relative to the physical-layer DSL rate.

parameter.name: ShapingBurstSize
parameter.description: Burst size in bytes. For both leaky bucket (constant rate shaping) and token bucket (variable rate shaping) this is the bucket size and is therefore the maximum burst size.

parameter.name: DefaultGateway
parameter.description: Represents the IP Address of the remote end Default Gateway established through PPPoE.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANPPPConnection.{i}.PortMapping.{i}.

If specified, the value of this parameter MUST be greater than or equal to the value of {{param|ExternalPort}}.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.WANPPPConnection.{i}.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The contents of this object SHOULD be identical for each such connection. This object is intended only for ''WANConnectionDevice''s that can support an Ethernet-layer on this interface (e.g., ''PPPoE'', ''IPoE'').

parameter.name: EthernetBytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted, including framing characters, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetBytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received, including framing characters, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets which were received over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetUnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address, including those that were discarded or not sent, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetUnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetDiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetDiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetMulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission, including those that were discarded or not sent, which were addressed to a multicast address, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetMulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were addressed to a multicast address, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetBroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission, including those that were discarded or not sent, which were addressed to a broadcast address, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetBroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were addressed to a broadcast address, over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: EthernetUnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol, received over all connections within the same ''WANConnectionDevice'' that share a common MAC address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.Layer2Bridging.
object.description: Layer 2 bridging configuration. Specifies bridges between layer 2 LAN and/or WAN interfaces. Bridges can be defined to include layer 2 filter criteria to selectively bridge traffic between interfaces. This object can be used to configure both 802.1D {{bibref|802.1D-2004}} and 802.1Q {{bibref|802.1Q-2005}} bridges. Not all 802.1D and 802.1Q features are modeled, and some additional features not present in either 802.1D or 802.1Q are modeled. If the Layer2Bridging object is implemented, the view that it provides of the CPE's underlying bridging configuration MUST be consistent with the view provided by any LANDevice and WAN**Connection objects. The implications of this are explained in Annex A.6.

parameter.name: MaxBridgeEntries
parameter.description: The maximum number of entries available in the {{object|Bridge}} table.

parameter.name: MaxDBridgeEntries
parameter.description: The maximum number of 802.1D {{bibref|802.1D-2004}} entries available in the {{object|Bridge}} table. A positive value for this parameter implies support for 802.1D. There is no guarantee that this many 802.1D Bridges can be configured. For example, the CPE might not be able simultaneously to support both 802.1D and 802.1Q Bridges.

parameter.name: MaxFilterEntries
parameter.description: The maximum number of entries available in the {{object|Filter}} table.

parameter.name: MaxMarkingEntries
parameter.description: The maximum number of entries available in the {{object|Marking}} table.

parameter.name: BridgeNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in the {{object|Bridge}} table.

parameter.name: FilterNumberOfEntries
